entry.title: Cinematica Topologica
entry.summary: A topological method for calculate average speed.

entry.title: Quantum spherical model
entry.summary: We define a "quantum spherical model", a quantum lattice model.

entry.title: A (2+1)-dimensional integrable spin model(the M-XXII equation) and Differential geometry of curves/surfaces
entry.summary: Using the differential geometry of curves and surfaces the Lakshmanan equivalent counterpart of the M-XXII equation is found ... .

entry.title: Drinfel'd Twists and Functional Bethe Ansatz
entry.summary: Using Functional Bethe Ansatz technique, factorizing Drinfel'd Twists for any finite dimensional irreducible representations of the Yangian Y(sl(2)) are constructed.

entry.title: A remark on boson-fermion correspondence
entry.summary: We give a simple explanaition of classical boson-fermion correspondence.

entry.title: Dynamics of charged particles and their radiation field
entry.summary: We investigate the adiabatic limit for classical charges coupled to their Maxwell field.

entry.title: Jets and connections in commutative and noncommutative geometry
entry.summary: It is emphasized that equivalent definitions of connections on modules over commutative rings are not so in noncommutative geometry.

entry.title: Krein's method in inverse scattering
entry.summary: A detailed discussion of the Krein's results (applicable for solving the inverse scattering problem) is given with complete proofs.

entry.title: Minimal Escape velocities
entry.summary: We give a new derivation of the minimal velocity estimates for unitary evolutions with some optimal bounds.

entry.title: Modern Mathematical Physics: what it should be?
entry.summary: Personal view of author on goals and content of Mathematical Physics.

entry.title: Periodic and almost periodic potentials in the inverse problems
entry.summary: We review basic ideas and basic examples of the theory of the inverse spectral problems.

entry.title: Analytic aspects of the Toda system: I. A Moser-Trudinger inequality
entry.summary: We analyze solutions of the Toda system and establish an optimal Moser-Trudinger inequality

entry.title: Characterizing Volume Forms
entry.summary: Old and new results for characterizing volume forms in functional integration.

entry.title: Monopoles
entry.summary: I survey the theory of Bogomolny monopoles and the various approaches to their study. These include the spectral curve, Nahm correspondence and rational maps.

entry.title: Weak asymptotics method
entry.summary: We present a new method for constructing solutions to nonlinear evolutionary equations describing the propagation and interaction of nonlinear waves.

entry.title: Differential geometry of fibre bundles over foliated manifolds
entry.summary: Any leafwise connection on a fibre bundle over a foliated manifold is proved to come from a connection on this fibre bundle.

entry.title: A remark on the matrix Airy function
entry.summary: An integral representation for matrix Airy function is presented

entry.title: The bracket and the evolution operator in covariant Hamiltonian field theory
entry.summary: No bracket determines the evolution operator in covariant (polysymplectic and multisymplectic) Hamiltonian field theory.

entry.title: Zonal Functions on $SO(p,q)$ Groups
entry.summary: Explicit expressions for zonal spherical functions of $SO(p,q)$ matrix groups are obtained using a generalized hypergeometric series of two variables.

entry.title: Noether conservation laws in infinite order Lagrangian formalism
entry.summary: Conservation laws related to the gauge invariance of Lagrangians and Euler-Lagrange operators in finite and infinite order Lagrangian formalisms are analyzed.

entry.title: Hypergeometric solutions of some algebraic equations
entry.summary: We give the hypergeometric solutions of some algebraic equations including the general fifth degree equation.

entry.title: Associated functions on $SO(p,q)$ Groups
entry.summary: Explicit expressions for associated spherical functions of $SO(p,q)$ matrix groups are obtained using a generalized hypergeometric series of two variables.

entry.title: Probabilistic Bell's Theorem
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a crucial error.

entry.title: Non-Archimedean Geometry and Physics on Adelic Spaces
entry.summary: This is a brief review article of various applications of non-Archimedean geometry, p-adic numbers and adeles in modern mathematical physics.

entry.title: On the definition of higher order differential operators in noncommutative geometry
entry.summary: Several definitions of differential operators on modules over noncommutative rings are discussed.

entry.title: On analytic solutions to NSE in 3-D torus
entry.summary: We consider NSE with $H^1$-initial conditions on the 3-dimensional torus and prove that there exists a solution that is analytic in all variables.

entry.title: A New Method of Strong-Coupling Expansion
entry.summary: In this paper, we propose a new method of strong-coupling expansion

entry.title: On Distribution of Zeros of Some Entire Functions
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate distribution of zeros for once quasipolynom and obtain exactly lower-bound for their modulus.

entry.title: Geodesic distances on density matrices
entry.summary: We find an upper bound for geodesic distances associated to monotone Riemannian metrics on positive definite matrices and density matrices.

entry.title: On Some p-Adic Series with Factorials
entry.summary: Some p-adic series with factorials are considered.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages; Published in Lecture Notes in Pure and Applied Mathematics, Vol. 192, 95-105 (1997)

entry.title: Fundamental solutions of pseudo-differential operators over p-adic fields
entry.summary: We show the existence of fundamental solutions for p-adic pseudo-differential operators with polynomial symbols.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Rend. Sem. Mat. Univ. Padova

entry.title: Laurent Expansions for Vertex Operators
entry.summary: A method is presented for using coherent vectors to calculate the explicit form of Schur polynomials which are the coefficients of Laurent expansion of a vertex operator.

entry.title: Dark Matter and Scale invariance
entry.summary: We point out that the vector meson $S$ first proposed by Weyl on the basis of scale invariance is a candidate for dark matter.

entry.title: Photon-added coherent states for exactly solvable Hamiltonians
entry.summary: Photon-added Gazeau-Klauder and Klauder-Perelomov coherent states are investigated. Application to P\"oschl-Teller potentials is given.

entry.title: Solvable Chaos
entry.summary: We present classes of discrete reversible systems which are at the same time chaotic and solvable.

entry.title: Integrable models with boundaries and defects
entry.summary: Two lectures given at the UK-Japan Winter School on 'Geometry and Analysis Towards Quantum Theory', Durham, January 2004.

entry.title: Remarks on modules over deformation quantization algebras
entry.summary: We study an asymptotic version of the Maslov-Hormander construction of Lagrangian distributions in terms of deformation quantization.

entry.title: Neumann system and hyperelliptic al functions
entry.summary: This article shows that the Neumann dynamical system is described well in terms of the Weierestrass hyperelliptic al functions.

entry.title: Random surfaces enumerating algebraic curves
entry.summary: These are notes from my lecture at 4ECM in Stockholm (June 2004).

entry.title: Why the Mickelsson-Faddeev algebra lacks unitary representations
entry.summary: A simple plausibility argument is given.

entry.title: Indefinite metric
entry.summary: The quantization of gauge fields with the help of the Gupta-Bleuler formalism is reviewed.

entry.title: Quantum Ergodicity and Mixing
entry.summary: This is an expository article for the Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics on the subject in the title.

entry.title: Topology in Physics
entry.summary: The phenomenon of quantum number fractionalization is explained. The relevance of non-trivial phonon field topology is emphasized.

entry.title: Solvable Sextic Equations
entry.summary: Criteria are given for determining whether an irreducible sextic equation with rational coefficients is algebraically solvable over the complex numbers.

entry.title: Computable Integrability. Chapter 1: General notions and ideas
entry.summary: This is a preliminary version of the Chapter 1 of a book "Computable Integrability"

entry.title: Withdrawn
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn.

entry.title: Towards a microscopic derivation of the large phonon Boltzmann equation
entry.summary: We outline the kinetic limit for weakly nonlinear wave equations

entry.title: Classical Mechanics
entry.summary: An overview of the foundations of Classical Mechanics
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics, ed. J.P. Francoise, G.L. Naber, Tsou Sheung Tsun, Vol. 1, 1--32, 2006, Elsevier, ISBN:978-0-12-512660-1.

entry.title: Quantization as a Consequence of Symmetry
entry.summary: It is argued that the Heisenberg relation on 4-spacetime is a necessary condition for the local gauge invariance of a classical wave in the 5-dimensional Kaluza-Klein theory.

entry.title: An Introduction to Hyperbolic Analysis
entry.summary: An introduction to Hyperbolic Analysis is presented.

entry.title: Random algebraic geometry, attractors and flux vacua
entry.summary: This is a submission to the Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics (Elsevier, 2006) and conforms to its referencing guidelines.

entry.title: Sobolev inequality for localization of pseudo-relativistic energy
entry.summary: In this article we present Sobolev-type inequalities for the localization of pseudo-relativistic energy.

entry.title: Geometric Phases
entry.summary: The differential geometric aspects of Geometric Phases are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 27 pages LATEX. To appear in the Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics, Elsevier 2006

entry.title: Interpretations of Renyi Entropies And Divergences
entry.summary: In this paper a new operational definition of Renyi entropy and Renyi divergence is presented. Other operational definitions are mentioned.

entry.title: The modified Vlasov equations
entry.summary: The Vlasov system of equations for a plasma is given in relativistic form, and using the correct expression for the "Lorentz" force, that is the one guaranteing real self-consistency.

entry.title: Lagrangian mechanics without ordinary differential equations
entry.summary: A variational proof is provided of the existence and uniqueness of evolutions of regular Lagrangian systems.

entry.title: Spectral Localization in the Hierarchical Anderson Model
entry.summary: We prove that a large class of hierarchical Anderson models with spectral dimension ${\rm d}\leq 2$ has only pure point spectrum.

entry.title: Remarks on the formation and decay of multidimensional shock waves
entry.summary: In this paper, we present a formula describing the formation and decay of shock wave type solutions in some special cases.

entry.title: Invariants of nine dimensional real Lie algebras with nontrivial Levi decomposition
entry.summary: The generalized Casimir invariants of real indecomposable Lie algebras admitting a nontrivial Levi decomposition are determined.

entry.title: Collisional invariants for the phonon Boltzmann equation
entry.summary: For the phonon Boltzmann equation with only pair collisions we characterize the set of all collisional invariants under some mild conditions on the dispersion relation.

entry.title: Infinite dimensional covariance and non relativistic limits in time dependent theories
entry.summary: We give some account of investigations for the role of infinite dimensional algebras in time dependent systems.

entry.title: Deformation Quantization and Quaternions
entry.summary: The deformation quantization of Moyal-Weyl star product of functions of quaternions is investigated.

entry.title: Moyal-Weyl Star-products as Quasiconformal Mappings
entry.summary: The relation between the Moyal-Weyl deformation quantization and quasiconformal mappings of Riemann surfaces of complex analysis are shown by several examples.

entry.title: New integrable systems and a curious realisation of SO(N)
entry.summary: A multiparameter class of integrable systems is introduced.

entry.title: Analytic geometry and semi-classical analysis
entry.summary: Expository paper on the relations between perturbation theory of pseudo-differential operators, finiteness theorems and deformations of Lagrangian varieties.

entry.title: Skew-orthogonal polynomials: the quartic case
entry.summary: We present an iterative technique to obtain skew-orthogonal polynomials with quartic weight, arising in the study of symplectic ensembles of random matrices.

entry.title: Kinetic Equations for Quantum Many-Particle Systems
entry.summary: The current status of the derivation of kinetic equations from quantum many-particle dynamics is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: for: Modern Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics, Springer Selecta, 12 pages

entry.title: Energy Current Correlations For Weakly Anharmonic Lattices
entry.summary: We discuss energy current correlations in thermal equilibrium and point out the linkage to the fluctuating Peierls equation.
entry.arxiv:comment: Contribution to ICMP 15, Rio de Janeiro, August 2006, 13 pages

entry.title: On the Boltzmann Equation for Weakly Nonlinear Wave Equations
entry.summary: We explain how the kinetic theory of L. Boltzmann is applied to weakly nonlinear wave equations.

entry.title: The one-dimensional Schrödinger-Newton equations
entry.summary: We prove an existence and uniqueness result for ground states of one-dimensional Schr\"{o}dinger-Newton equations.

entry.title: Mathematical Modeling of Control Dynamical Systems
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a crucial mistakes.

entry.title: Piecewise Linear Phase Transitions
entry.summary: It is shown how simple assumptions lead to piecewise linear behavior, which is observed in certain phase transitions.

entry.title: A class of exactly solvable Schroedinger equation with moving boundary conditions
entry.summary: Using first and second order supersymmetry formalism we obtain a class of exactly solvable potentials subject to moving boundary conditions.

entry.title: Remarks on the Friedman equations
entry.summary: We give some heuristic results for FRW situations with Ricci flow.

entry.title: Classical and quantum integrability
entry.summary: We give a sufficient condition for quantising integrable systems.

entry.title: Attractors for a deconvolution model of turbulence
entry.summary: We consider a deconvolution model for 3D periodic flows. We show the existence of a global attractor for the model.

entry.title: Group Classification of Burgers' Equations
entry.summary: In this work we carry out a complete group classification of Burgers' equations.

entry.title: A note on Stormer condition for decomposability of positive maps
entry.summary: We present a partial characterization of matrices in $M_n(\cA)^+$ satisfying the St{\o}rmer condition.

entry.title: More on the quantum potential
entry.summary: A possible thermalization of Fisher information is suggested for certain situations.

entry.title: Remarks on Fisher information
entry.summary: Some situations are discussed where subquantum oscillations in momentum arise in connectiion with Fisher information and the quantum potential.

entry.title: Some Integrals of the Dedekind Eta-function
entry.summary: This note presents selected values of definite integrals whose integrand contains a power of the Dedekind function having imaginary argument.

entry.title: Pendulum Integration and Elliptic Functions
entry.summary: Revisiting canonical integration of the classical pendulum around its unstable equilibrium, normal hyperbolic canonical coordinates are constructed

entry.title: Two-dimensional Ricci flow as a stochastic process
entry.summary: We prove that, for a two-dimensional Riemannian manifold, the Ricci flow is obtained by a Wiener process.

entry.title: Lifting Frenet Formulas
entry.summary: In this study, we conclude the vertical, complete and horizontal lifts of Frenet formulas given by (1) and defined on space R3 to its tangent space TR3 = R6.

entry.title: Hamilton Dynamics on Clifford Kaehler Manifolds
entry.summary: This paper presents Hamilton dynamics on Clifford Kaeler manifolds. In the end, the some results related to Clifford Kaehler dynamical systems are also discussed.

entry.title: Remarks on Robin's and Niocolas Inequalities
entry.summary: Robin's Conjecture is strengthened, deformed, and proved. Nicolas conjecture follows.

entry.title: On the N-dimensional hydrogen atom in momentum representation
entry.summary: We derive the wave function for N-dimensional hydrogen atom in the momentum representation with the phase factor using the generating function method and Hankel's integral.

entry.title: Cremmer-Gervais Quantum Lie Algebra
entry.summary: We describe a quantum Lie algebra based on the Cremmer-Gervais R-matrix. The algebra arises upon a restriction of an infinite-dimensional quantum Lie algebra.

entry.title: Superintegrable non-autonomous Hamiltonian systems
entry.summary: The Mishenko-Fomenko theorem on action-angle coordinates for superintegrable autonomous Hamiltonian systems is extended to the non-autonomous ones.

entry.title: Split octonions and Maxwell equations
entry.summary: A formulation of the Maxwell equations in terms of the split octonions is presented.

entry.title: An Asymptotic relation for Hadjicostas Formula
entry.summary: We derive an asymptotic formula which in some cases generalize Hadjicostas formula

entry.title: Supertranslations to all orders
entry.summary: The transformation laws of the general linear superfield and chiral superfields under N=1 supertranslations are tabulated to all orders in the supertranslation parameters.

entry.title: An urn model associated with the Jacobi polynomials
entry.summary: We consider an urn model leading to a random walk that can be solved explicitly in terms of the well known Jacobi polynomials.

entry.title: The Simple Nonpolar Continuum Media. Part III. the Asymmetric Elasticity (N=2)
entry.summary: The nonclassical model of elasticity was presented

entry.title: The group of causal automorphisms
entry.summary: The group of causal automorphisms on Minkowski space-time is given and its structure is analyzed.

entry.title: Ergodicity of Two Dimensional Turbulence
entry.summary: We review the work of Hairer and Mattingly on ergodicity of two dimensional Navier-Stokes dynamics and discuss some open mathematical problems in the theory of 2d turbulence.

entry.title: Random integral currents
entry.summary: For nice functions, invariant means over integral currents (certain generalized surfaces), can be uniquely defined.

entry.title: Remarks on gravity and quantum mechanics
entry.summary: Some relations between conformal relativity and Weyl-Dirac theory are rephrased and clarified.

entry.title: A Spacetime for SU(N)
entry.summary: The rotations, boosts, and translations in an N^2-dimensional spacetime are shown to be related to the fundamental commutators, anticommutators, and Clebsch-Gordan coefficients, respectively, of SU(N).

entry.title: Critical phenomena in the Dyson hierarchical model and renormalization group
entry.summary: We review some results on the critical phenomena in the Dyson hierarchical model and renormalization group.

entry.title: A generalization of the inequality of Audenaert et al
entry.summary: We extend the inequality of Audenaert et al to general von Neumann algebras.

entry.title: Irreversibility and maximum generation in $κ$-generalized statistical mechanics
entry.summary: Irreversibility and maximum generation in $\kappa$-generalized statistical mechanics

entry.title: A General Integral Identity
entry.summary: A family of general integral identities is derived and several applications of physical interest are presented

entry.title: Generators of simple Lie superalgebras in characteristic 0
entry.summary: It is shown that any finite dimensional simple Lie superalgebra over an algebraically closed field of characteristic 0 is generated by 2 elements.

entry.title: Calculation of tunneling rates across a barrier with continuous potential
entry.summary: Here, approximate, but accurate expressions for calculation of wavefunctions and tunneling rates are obtained using the method of uniform asymptotic expansion.

entry.title: Unified Analytic Electron Interaction Integrals Over Slater Orbitals for Diatomic Molecules
entry.summary: A unified formula for analytical evaluation of two-center exchange, hybrid and coulombic type integrals is presented.

entry.title: Evolution of simple configurations of gravitating gas
entry.summary: We considered the dynamics of gravitating gas - a continuous media with peculiar properties. The exact solutions of its Euler equations for simple initial conditions is obtained.

entry.title: An index 2F2 hypergeometric transform
entry.summary: We construct a new one-parameter family of index hypergeometric transforms associated with the relativistic pseudoharmonic oscillator by using coherent states analysis.

entry.title: Bäcklund--Darboux transformations of traslationally shape-invariant potentials
entry.summary: Article withdrawn
entry.arxiv:comment: Withdrawn because of existence of a completely different version, with different title

entry.title: Limit Theorems for the Disordered Quantum Walk
entry.summary: We study the disordered quantum walk in one dimension, and obtain the weak limit theorem.

entry.title: Eigenforms and Quantum Physics
entry.summary: This essay is a discussion of Heinz von Foerster's concept of eigenform and its relationship with the foundations of physics.

entry.title: Recent results in semiclassical approximation with rough potentials
entry.summary: This is an extended abstract for the conference "Microlocal2011 : Microlocal Methods in Mathematical Physics and Global Analysis Universit\"at T\"ubingen, June 14 - 18, 2011"

entry.title: The spectral action for sub-Dirac operators
entry.summary: In this paper, for foliations with spin leaves, we compute the spectral action for sub-Dirac operators.

entry.title: On Distribution of Zeros of Some Quazipolynoms
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate distribution of zeros for only quasipolynom and obtain exactly lower-bound for their modulus.

entry.title: $λ$-symmetries and Jacobi Last Multiplier
entry.summary: We show that $\lambda$-symmetries can be algorithmically obtained by using the Jacobi last multiplier. Several examples are provided.

entry.title: One-dimensional mechanical networks and crystals
entry.summary: We prove thermal expansion and Hooke-s law for crystals via an one-dimensional microscopic model.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Moscow Math. Journal, 2006, v. 6, No. 2, pp. 353-358

entry.title: Nambu-Poisson dynamics with some applications
entry.summary: Short introduction in NPD with several applications to (in)finite dimensional problems of mechanics, hydrodynamics, M-theory and quanputing is given.

entry.title: Stochastic integrability and the KPZ equation
entry.summary: The emerging field of stochastic integrability is outlined.
entry.arxiv:comment: published in IAMP News Bulletin, April 2012

entry.title: On a fractional quantum potential
entry.summary: We use the fractional calculus of Kobelev to produce a fractional quantum potential for a corresponding Schrodinger type equation.

entry.title: A Primer on Differential Forms
entry.summary: This primer is intended as an introduction to differential forms, a central object in modern mathematical physics, for scientists and engineers.

entry.title: On stationary solutions of two-dimensional Euler Equation
entry.summary: We study the geometry of streamlines and stability properties for steady state solutions of the Euler equations for ideal fluid.

entry.title: Lectures on Topos Quantum Theory
entry.summary: This is a series of lecture notes explaining topos theory and its application in physics.

entry.title: Relativistic Orbits and the Zeros of $\wp(Θ)$
entry.summary: A simple expression for the zeros of Weierstrass' function is given which follows from a formula for relativistic orbits.

entry.title: Erratum to: From Uncertainty Principles to Wegner Estimates
entry.summary: Erratum to "From Uncertainty Principles to Wegner Estimates".

entry.title: An Analytical Solution To A Special Case Of The Weber-Schafheitlin Integral
entry.summary: Special cases of Weber-Schafheitlin type integrals are evaluated analytically.

entry.title: Einstein's Special Relativity: The Hyperbolic Geometric Viewpoint
entry.summary: The analytic hyperbolic geometric viewpoint of Einstein's special theory of relativity is presented.

entry.title: On the Hilbert space dimension of systems with second class constraints
entry.summary: It is shown that quantized dynamical system with second class constraints has infinite dimensional Hilbert space.

entry.title: Case's Eigenvalues by Markel's Matrix
entry.summary: A method of computing Case's eigenvalues is proposed. The eigenvalues are obtained as eigenvalues of a tridiagonal matrix.

entry.title: A remark on constrained von Karman theories
entry.summary: We derive the Euler-Lagrange equation corresponding to a variant of non-Euclidean constrained von Karman theories.

entry.title: A new nonlinear generalization of the Dirac equation
entry.summary: We postulate a new nonlinear generalization of the Dirac equation for an electron. Basic properties of the new equation are considered.

entry.title: Quantum Tomography From Few Full-Rank Observables
entry.summary: We establish that the PhaseLift algorithm recovers pure states from a constant number of full-rank observables with high probability.

entry.title: Some Properties of a Class of QM Phase Space Measures
entry.summary: We have a look at the probability measures induced by Schrodinger wave functions on phase space.

entry.title: Wavelets in field theory
entry.summary: We discuss the use of Daubechies wavelets in discretizing quantum field theories.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, for proceedings of light cone 2013, Skiathos, Greece

entry.title: Quasisolution of the inverse 3D aerohydrodynamics problem
entry.summary: In the article we generalise the quasisolution approach to the planar aerohydrodynamics problems to 3D case. We search for solution in the form of the linear spline.

entry.title: Applications of the Thick Distributional Calculus
entry.summary: We give several applications of the thick distributional calculus. We consider homogeneous distributions, point source fields, and higher order derivatives of order $0.$

entry.title: Symmetry problem
entry.summary: A novel approach to an old symmetry problem is developed. A new proof is given for the following symmetry problem, studied earlier.

entry.title: Liouville theorem for Beltrami flow
entry.summary: We prove that the Beltrami flow of ideal fluid in $R^3$ of a finite energy is zero.

entry.title: Mathematical Caricature of Large Waves
entry.summary: The Kadomtsev-Petviiashvili equation is considered as a mathematical caricature of large and rogue waves.

entry.title: Adiabatics using quantum action
entry.summary: For slow--fast quantum systems, we compute first corrections to the quantum action and to the effective slow Hamiltonian.

entry.title: K- causality and domain theory
entry.summary: We prove that a certain type of stably causal space times are bi continuous posets.

entry.title: Comment on "Classical Mechanics of Nonconservative Systems"
entry.summary: A Comment on the Letter by C. R. Galley, Phys. Rev. Lett. 110, 174301 (2013).

entry.title: A. Cormack's last inversion formula and a FBP reconstruction
entry.summary: A reconstruction of a function from integrals over the family of confocal paraboloids is given by a FBP formula.

entry.title: Generating functions of Chebyshev polynomials in three variables
entry.summary: In this paper generating functions of three variables Chebyshev polynomials associated with the root system of $A_3$ Lie algebra are obtained.

entry.title: Nahm's, Basu-Harvey-Terashima's equations and Lie superalgebras
entry.summary: We discuss the correspondence between Nahm's equations, the Basu-Harvey-Terashima equations, and Lie superalgebras.

entry.title: Global Non-perturbative Deformation Quantization of a Poisson Algebra
entry.summary: A proposed definition is given for the quantization of a Poisson algebra, taking the quantum product to be a geodesic on the manifold of associative products.

entry.title: A new solvable many-body problem of goldfish type
entry.summary: A new solvable many-body problem of goldfish type is introduced and the behavior of its solutions is tersely discussed.

entry.title: Fermionic Computations for Integrable Hierarchies
entry.summary: We present a unified fermionic approach to compute the tau-functions and the n-point functions of integrable hierarchies related to some infinite-dimensional Lie algebras and their representations.

entry.title: WDVV Equations
entry.summary: The paper aims to point out a novel geometric characterisation of the WDVV equations of 2D topological field theory.

entry.title: Haantjes Manifolds and Veselov Systems
entry.summary: A novel geometric interpretation of the solutions of the WDVV equations formerly found by A.P. Veselov is suggested.

entry.title: Frobenius Manifolds, Spectral Curves, and Integrable Hierarchies
entry.summary: We formulate some conjectures that relates semisimple Frobenius manifolds, their spectral curves and integrable hierarchies.

entry.title: Remarks on the inhomogeneous fractional nonlinear Schrodinger equation
entry.summary: Using a sharp Gagliardo-Nirenberg type inequality, well-posedness issues of the initial value problem for a fractional inhomogeneous Schrodinger equation are investigated.

entry.title: Towards theory of C-symmetries
entry.summary: The concept of C-symmetry originally appeared in PT-symmetric quantum mechanics is studied within the Krein spaces framework.

entry.title: On continuous causal isomorphisms
entry.summary: It is shown that continuous causal isomorphisms on two-dimensional Minkowski spacetime can be characterized by the invariance of wave equations.

entry.title: Analysis of Dirichlet forms on graphs
entry.summary: In this thesis, we study connections between metric and combinatorial graphs from a Dirichlet space point of view.

entry.title: Crystals in the Void
entry.summary: We study the problem of the crystal formation in the vacuum.

entry.title: Finding Exact Values For Infinite Sums
entry.summary: This paper offers a solution method that allows one to find exact values for a large class of convergent series of rational terms. Sums of this form arise often in problems dealing with Quantum Field Theory.

entry.title: Generating Functions for Multi-j-Symbols
entry.summary: A formula is derived that provides generating functions for any multi-j-symbol, such as the 3-j-symbol, the 6-j-symbol, the 9-j-symbol, etc. The result is completely determined by geometrical objects (loops and curves) in the graph of the the multi-j-symbol. A geometric-combinatorical interpretation for multi-j-symbols is given.

entry.title: Generalized Weierstrass representation for surfaces and Lax-Phillips scattering theory for automorphic functions
entry.summary: Relation between generalized Weierstrass representation for conformal immersion of generic surfaces into three-dimensional space and Lax-Phillips scattering theory for automorphic functions is considered.

entry.title: Identities involving elementary symmetric functions
entry.summary: A systematic procedure for generating certain identities involving elementary symmetric functions is proposed. These identities, as particular cases, lead to new identities for binomial and q-binomial coefficients.

entry.title: Physico--Mathematical Interactions: The Chern--Simons Story
entry.summary: The essential role played by Chern--Simons terms in a variety of physical models provides yet another illustration of the unexpected but profound interactions between the two disciplines.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages; contribution to proceedings dedicated to the 65th Anniversary of L.D. Faddeev

entry.title: Deduction of the law of motion of the charges from Maxwell equations
entry.summary: By exploiting suitably a fundamental theorem by Hilbert, we show that the equation of motion of the electric charges is a consequence of Maxwell field equations.

author.name: A. Loinger
author.arxiv:affiliation: Dipartimento di Fisica, Universita' di Milano, Italy

entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, PDF from MS-Word97, e-mail: sloinger@tin.it

entry.title: Uniform spectral properties of one-dimensional quasicrystals, I. Absence of eigenvalues
entry.summary: We consider discrete one-dimensional Schr\"odinger operators with Sturmian potentials. For a full-measure set of rotation numbers including the Fibonacci case we prove absence of eigenvalues for all elements in the hull.

entry.title: On the geometric arena of supermechanics
entry.summary: In the case of simple graded manifolds utilized in supermechanics, supervector fields and exterior superforms are represented by global sections of smooth vector bundles.

entry.title: Constrained Fock spaces as Virasoro modules
entry.summary: The method of constrained Hamiltonian systems can be used to reduce Fock modules. It is applied to the Virasoro algebra, where a possibly new realization is found.

entry.title: The Atiyah-Singer fixed point theorem and the gauge field copy problem
entry.summary: A condition for the existence of false gauge field copies in terms of the Lefschetz number of a certain differential operator is presented.

entry.title: Comment on ``A simple expression for the terms in the Baker-Campbell-Hausdorff series''
entry.summary: It is pointed out that Reinsch's matrix operation formulation of calculating the Baker-Campbell-Hausdorff series [math-ph/9905012] is equivalent to the straightforward series expansion. The amount of calculation does not decrease by his method.

entry.title: New bounds on the Lieb-Thirring constants
entry.summary: Improved estimates on the constants $L_{\gamma,d}$, for $1/2<\gamma<3/2$, $d\in N$ in the inequalities for the eigenvalue moments of Schr\"{o}dinger operators are established.

entry.title: On the Connes-Kreimer construction of Hopf Algebras
entry.summary: We give a universal construction of families of Hopf $P$-algebras for any Hopf operad $P$. As a special case, we recover the Connes-Kreimer Hopf algebra of rooted trees.

entry.title: Eigenfunctions, transfer matrices, and absolutely continuous spectrum of one-dimensional Schrodinger operators
entry.summary: Neat stuff about eigenfunctions, transfer matrices, and a.c. spectrum of one-dimensional Schrodinger operators

entry.title: Integrable systems in spaces of arbitrary dimension
entry.summary: The $2n$ dimensional manifold with two mutually commutative operators of differentiation is introduced. Nontrivial multidimensional integrable systems connected with arbitrary graded (semisimple) algebras are constructed. The general solution of them is presented in explicit form.

entry.title: Point interactions in a tube
entry.summary: We discuss discuss spectral and scattering properties of a particle confined to a straight Dirichlet tube in $\mathbb{R}^3$ with a family of point interactions.
entry.arxiv:comment: AMSTeX, 10 pages, written for the jubilee volume dedicated to the 60th birthday of Sergio Albeverio

entry.title: Distributional Borel Summability of Odd Anharmonic Oscillators
entry.summary: It is proved that the divergent Rayleigh-Schrodinger perturbation expansions for the eigenvalues of any odd anharmonic oscillator are Borel summable in the distributional sense to the resonances naturally associated with the system.

entry.title: BRS Cohomology And The Chern Character In Non-Commutative Geometry
entry.summary: We establish a general local formula computing the topological anomaly of gauge theories in the framework of non-commutative geometry.

entry.title: Hamilton-Jakobi method for classical mechanics in Grassmann algebra
entry.summary: We present the Hamilton-Jakobi method for the classical mechanics with constrains in Grassmann algebra. In the frame of this method the solution for the classical system characterized by the SUSY Lagrangian is obtained.

entry.title: The Reeh-Schlieder Property for the Dirac Field on Static Spacetimes
entry.summary: We prove the Reeh-Schlieder property for the ground- and KMS-states states of the massive Dirac Quantum field on a static globally hyperbolic 4 dimensional spacetime.

entry.title: Tables of Integrals of Complex-valued Functions of p-Adic arguments
entry.summary: Part I. Some Facts From p-Adic Analysis. Part II. Tables of Integrals.

entry.title: Justification of the limiting absorption principle in R2
entry.summary: The limiting absorption principle in two-dimensional space is justified for a second-order elliptic operators. Necessary and sufficient conditions for the right-hand side are given for this principle to be valid.

entry.title: The Energy-Momentum Tensor for Gravitational Interactions
entry.summary: Within the Lagrange formalism we show that the gauge invariant total energy-momentum tensor for gravitational interactions is zero. If the equations of motion are satisfied the energy tensor is conserved.

entry.title: PT symmetric form of the Hulthen potential
entry.summary: The fourth, missing example of an exactly solvable complex potential with PT symmetry V(x) = [V(-x)]^* defined on a bent contour and leading, at the real energies, to the Jacobi polynomial wave functions is found in a generalized Hulthen interaction.

entry.title: Beyond Octonions
entry.summary: We investigate Clifford Algebras structure over non-ring division algebras. We show how projection over the real field produces the standard Attiyah-Bott-Shapiro classification.

entry.title: Dominos and the Gaussian free field
entry.summary: We define a scaling limit of the height function on the domino tiling model (dimer model) on simply-connected regions in Z^2 and show that it is the ``massless free field'', a Gaussian process with independent coefficients when expanded in the eigenbasis of the Laplacian.

entry.title: Absolute Continuity of the Floquet Spectrum for a Nonlinearly Forced Harmonic Oscillator
entry.summary: We prove that the Floquet spectrum of a class of time-periodic Schroedinger equations under a a mildly nonlinear resonant forcing is purely absolutely continuous.

entry.title: Asymptotic behaviour of a solution for Kadomtsev-Petviashvili-2 equation
entry.summary: An asymptotic behaviour of solution of Kadomtsev-Petviashvili-2 equation is obtained as $t\to\infty$ uniformly with respect to spatial variables.

entry.title: An Introduction to Quantum Algebras and Their Applications
entry.summary: A very elementary introduction to quantum algebras is presented and a few examples of their physical applications are mentioned.

author.name: R. Jaganathan
author.arxiv:affiliation: The Institute of Mathematical Sciences, India

entry.title: Combinatorial Identities from the Spectral Theory of Quantum Graphs
entry.summary: We present a few combinatorial identities which were encountered in our work on the spectral theory of quantum graphs. They establish a new connection between the theory of random matrix ensembles and combinatorics.

entry.title: Lieb-Thirring Inequalities
entry.summary: This is a brief review of Lieb-Thirring inequalities for eigenvalues of the Schroedinger operator and lower bounds for the quantum mechanical kinetic energy (and some generalizations) in R^n.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Kluwer Encyclopedia of Mathematics, Supplement vol.II, p. 311-313 (2000)

entry.title: Thomas-Fermi Theory
entry.summary: This is a brief review of the Thomas-Fermi ("statistical" or "density functional") theory of atoms and molecules.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Kluwer Encyclopedia of Mathematics, Supplement vol.II, p.455-457 (2000)

entry.title: On the obstruction to the exactness of the variational bicomplex
entry.summary: We study the obstruction to the exactness of the variational complex for a field theory on an affine bundle.

entry.title: Cohomology of the infinite-order jet space
entry.summary: De Rham cohomology, $d_V$- and $d_H$-cohomology of the differential algebra of locally pull-back exterior forms on the infinite-order jet manifold of a smooth fibre bundle are calculated.

entry.title: On p-adic path integral
entry.summary: Feynman's path integral is generalized to quantum mechanics on p-adic space and time. Such p-adic path integral is analytically evaluated for quadratic Lagrangians. Obtained result has the same form as that one in ordinary quantum mechanics.

entry.title: Some Remarks Concerning the Feynman "Integral over All Paths" Method
entry.summary: Suppose we have two nonequivalent but s-equivalent Lagrange functions, the question arises: are they both equally well fitted for the Feynman quantization procedure or do they lead to two different quantization schemes.

entry.title: Feynman Equation in Hamiltonian Quantum Field Theory
entry.summary: Functional Schr\"{o}dinger equations for interacting fields are solved via rigorous non-perturbative Feynman type integrals.

entry.title: Entropy production in quantum spin systems
entry.summary: We consider a quantum spin system consisting of a finite subsystem connected to infinite reservoirs at different temperatures. In this setup we define nonequilibrium steady states and prove that the rate of entropy production in such states is nonnegative.

entry.title: Some Comments on the RHS Formulation of Resonance Scattering
entry.summary: We discuss the validity of a formula concerning a relation between functionals in quantum resonance scattering, which is often used in the current literature.

entry.title: Mapping Integer Order Neumann Functions To Real Orders
entry.summary: In a recent paper we unified Bessel functions of different orders .Here we extend the unification to other linairely independant solutions to Bessel equation, Neumann's and Hankel's functions

entry.title: Nonlinear boundary value problem of magnetic insulation
entry.summary: On the basis of generalization of upper and lower solution method to the singular two point boundary value problems, the existence theorem of solutions for the system, which models a process of magnetic insulation in plasma is proved.

entry.title: On bifurcation points of the stationary Vlasov-Maxwell system with bifurcation direction
entry.summary: The theorem on the existence of bifurcation points of the stationary solutions for the Vlasov-Maxwell system with bifurcation direction is proved.

entry.title: Path integral formulation of constrained systems with singular-higher order Lagrangian
entry.summary: Systems with singular higher order- Lagrangians are investigated by using the extended form of the canonical method. Besides, the canonical path integral formulation is generalized using the Hamilton- jacobi formulation to investigate singular systems

entry.title: Canonical formulation treatment of a free relativistic spinning particle
entry.summary: The canonical method of constrained system is discussed. The equations of motion for a free relativistic spinning particle are obtained without using gauge fixing conditions. The quantization of this model is discussed.

entry.title: Quantization of singular systems with second order Lagrangians
entry.summary: The path integral formulation of singular systems with second order Lagrangian is studied by using the canonical path integral method. The path integral of Podolsky electrodynamics is studied.

entry.title: Riemannian Geometries
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author. It will be replaced, substantially modified, by sections of the author's completed PhD thesis.

entry.title: Finite action solutions of SO(2,1) Hitchin's equations
entry.summary: We present a 1-parameter family of finite action solutions to the $S0(2,1)$ Hitchin's equations and explore some of its basic properties. For a fixed value of the parameter, the solution is smooth. We conclude by showing a multi-particle generalization of our basic solutions.

entry.title: The $M_{L}(z);C_{L}(z);W_{L}(z)$ associated Laguerre Polynomials
entry.summary: In a previous paper we deformed Hermite polynomials to three associated polynomials .Here we apply the same deformation to Laguerre polynomials .

entry.title: The Volterra lattice as a gradient flow
entry.summary: The Volterra lattice is considered. New gradient interpretation for this dynamical system is proposed. This interpretation seems to be more natural than existing ones.

entry.title: Propagation and interaction of shock waves of quasilinear equation
entry.summary: We propose a new regularization method for constructing a shock wave type solution with nonsmooth front (interaction of shock waves) for quasilinear equations in the one-dimensional case.

entry.title: A unified representation of the q-oscillator and the q-plane
entry.summary: Using deformations inspired by relativistic considerations and phase space symmetry, we deform the position and momentum operators in one dimension. The resulting algebra is shown to yield the q-oscillator algebra in one limiting case and the q-plane commutation relation in another.

entry.title: Self-dual Chern-Simons Vortices on Riemann Surfaces
entry.summary: We study self-dual multi-vortex solutions of Chern-Simons Higgs theory in a background curved spacetime. The existence and decaying property of a solution are demonstrated.

entry.title: More noncommutative 4-spheres
entry.summary: New examples of noncommutative 4-spheres are introduced.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, AMS-LaTeX, final version, revised, to appear in Lett.Math.Phys

entry.title: Multi-dimensional Diffeomorphism and Current Algebras from Virasoro and Kac-Moody Currents
entry.summary: The recently constructed Fock representations of $N$-dimensional diffeomorphism and current algebras are reformulated in terms of one-dimensional currents, satisfying Virasoro and affine Kac-Moody algebras.

entry.title: Remark on the Serre-Swan theorem for non-compact manifolds
entry.summary: The Serre-Swan theorem provides the link between projective modules of finite rank and vector bundles over compact manifolds, and plays a prominent role in non-commutative geometry. Its extension to non-compact manifolds is discussed.

entry.title: Factorization of Unitary Matrices
entry.summary: Factorization of an $n\times n$ unitary matrix as a product of $n$ diagonal matrices containing only phases interlaced with $n-1$ orthogonal matrices each one generated by a real vector as well as an explicit form for the Weyl factorization are found.

entry.title: Meromorphic Solutions to a Differential--Difference Equation Describing Certain Self-Similar Potentials
entry.summary: In this paper we prove the existence of meromorphic solutions to a nonlinear differential difference equation that describe certain self-similar potentials for the Schroedinger operator.

entry.title: Numerical computation of resonance poles in scattering theory
entry.summary: We present a possible way of computing resonance poles and modes in scattering theory. Numerical examples are given for the scattering of electromagnetic waves by finite-size photonic crystals.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 4 figures, submitted to Phys. Rev. E

entry.title: Impenetrable Barriers and Canonical Quantization
entry.summary: We address a conceptual issue of reconciling the traditional canonical quantization framework of quantum theory with the spatially restricted quantum dynamics and the related spectral problems for confined and global observables of the quantum system.

entry.title: Stocastic variational principle on riemannian manifolds
entry.summary: Some little considerations concerning the application of the Theory of Dirichlet Forms to stocastic variational principle on riemannian manifolds are performed

entry.title: Series Representation of the Modified Bessel Functions
entry.summary: Some power series representations of the modified Bessel functions (McDonald functions $K_{\alpha}$) are derived using the relatively little known formalism of fractional derivatives. The resulting summation formulae are believed to be new.

entry.title: Numerically efficient version of the T-matrix method
entry.summary: A version of the projection method for solving the scattering problem for acoustic and electromagnetic waves is proposed and shown to be more efficient numerically than the earlier ones because the corresponding matrix is not ill-conditioned.

entry.title: Classification of solutions of a Toda system in R^2
entry.summary: We consider solutions of a Toda system for SU(N+1) and show that any solution with finite exponential integral cam be obtained from a rational curve in complex projective space of dimension N

entry.title: Free particle on SU(2) group manifold
entry.summary: In the present paper detailed coordinate free description of the classical and quantum dynamics of free particle on SU(2) group manifold is carried out.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX 2e, 9 pages, no figures, uses iopart.cls

entry.title: The q-deformation of AKNS-D Hierarchy
entry.summary: In this paper, we considered the q-deformation of AKNS-D hierarchy, proved the bilinear identity and give out the $\tau$-function of the q-deformed AKNS-D hierarchy.

entry.title: Approach to Equilibrium for a Forced Burgers Equation
entry.summary: We show that approach to equilibrium in certain forced Burgers equations is implied by a decay estimate on a suitable intrinsic semigroup estimate, and we verify this estimate in a variety of cases including a periodic force.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Journal of Evolution Equations

entry.title: Singularity Formation in 2+1 Wave Maps
entry.summary: We present numerical evidence that singularities form in finite time during the evolution of 2+1 wave maps from spherically equivariant initial data of sufficient energy.

entry.title: How should one define entropy production for nonequilibrium quantum spin systems?
entry.summary: This paper discusses entropy production in nonequilibrium steady states for infinite quantum spin systems. Rigorous results have been obtained recently in this area, but a physical discussion shows that some questions of principle remain to be clarified.

entry.title: Combinatorial identities for binary necklaces from exact ray-splitting trace formulae
entry.summary: Based on an exact trace formula for a one-dimensional ray-splitting system, we derive novel combinatorial identities for cyclic binary sequences (P\'olya necklaces).

entry.title: Fractality of certain quantum states
entry.summary: We prove the theorem announced in Phys. Rev. Lett. {\bf 85}:5022, 2001 concerning the existence and properties of fractal states for the Schr\"odinger equation in the infinite one-dimensional well.

entry.title: A counterexample to the uniqueness result of Cox and Thompson
entry.summary: A counterexample is given to the uniqueness result given in the paper by J.Cox and K.Thompson, "Note on the uniqueness of the solution of an equation of interest in inverse scattering problem", J. Math.Phys., 11, N3, (1970), 815-817.

entry.title: Separation of variables for quantum integrable models related to $ U_q(\hat{sl}_N) $
entry.summary: In this paper we construct separated variables for quantum integrable models related to the algebra $U_q(\hat{sl}_N)$. This generalizes the results by Sklyanin for $N=2,3$.

entry.title: Applications of the Wulff construction to the number theory
entry.summary: We apply the geometric construction of solutions of some variational problems of combinatorics to estimate the number of partitions and of plane partitions of an integer.

entry.title: Practical non-Abelian Stokes theorem for topologically nontrivial Wilson loops
entry.summary: A practical implementation of the non-Abelian Stokes theorem for topologically nontrivial loops (knots) with possible intersections is proposed.

entry.title: Fluctuations of the Entropy Production in Anharmonic Chains
entry.summary: We prove the Gallavotti-Cohen fluctuation theorem for a model of heat conduction through a chain of anharmonic oscillators coupled to two Hamiltonian reservoirs at different temperatures.

entry.title: Butterflies and topological quantum numbers
entry.summary: The Hofstadter model illustrates the notion of topological quantum numbers and how they account for the quantization of the Hall conductance. It gives rise to colorful fractal diagrams of butterflies where the colors represent the topological quantum numbers.

entry.title: Asymptotic properties of the differential equation $h^3(h''+h')=1$
entry.summary: We derive the form of the asymptotic series, as $t\to +\infty$, for a general solution $h(t)$ of the non-linear differential equation $h(t)^{3}(h''(t)+h'(t))=1$.

entry.title: On the Spectrum of Holonomy Algebras
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn by the authors

entry.title: Regularization of Ill-Posed Problems with Unbounded Operators
entry.summary: Variational regularization and the quasisolutions method are justified for unbounded closed, possibly nonlinear, operators. The argument is quite simple and yields general results.

entry.title: Completely integrable classical systems connected with semi-simple Lie algebras. II
entry.summary: The complete integrability of a class of dynamical systems with the potential v(q)=q^{-2}+c q^2 is proved.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, an old paper (1976) posted for archival purposes

entry.title: The Thom Class and Localization of SUSY QM Generating Functional
entry.summary: We demonstrate the usage of explicit form of the Thom class found by Mathai and Quillen for the definition of generating functional of a simple supersymmetric quantum mechanical model.

entry.title: Lax representation for the systems of S.Kowalevskaya type
entry.summary: We descibe a number of dynamical systems that are generalizations of S. Kowalevskaya system and admit the Lax representation.

entry.title: Complexes of modules over exceptional Lie superalgebras $E (3,8)$ and $E (5,10)$
entry.summary: In this paper complexes of generalized Verma modules over the infinite-dimensional exceptional Lie superalgebras $E (3,8)$ and $E(5,10)$ are constructed and studied.

entry.title: The covariant Lyapunov tensor and the Lyapunov stability with respect to time-dependent Riemannian metrics
entry.summary: We show that any solution of a smooth first order dynamic equation can be made Lyapunov stable at will by the choice of an appropriate time-dependent Riemannian metric.

entry.title: On the derivatives of generalized Gegenbauer polynomials
entry.summary: We prove some new formulae for the derivatives of the generalized Gegenbauer polynomials associated to the Lie algebra $A_2$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, no figures; submitted to Theor. Math. Phys

entry.title: Some Theorems in Thermoelasticity for Micropolar Porous Media
entry.summary: Within the context of a linear theory of heat-flux dependent thermoelasticity for micropolar porous media some variational principles and a reciprocal relation are derived.

entry.title: On entanglement of states and quantum correlations
entry.summary: In this paper we present the novel qualities of entanglement of formation for general (so also infinite dimensional) quantum systems and we introduce the notion of coefficient of quantum correlations. Our presentation stems from rigorous description of entanglement of formation.

entry.title: On Kolgomorov-Sinai entropy and its quantization
entry.summary: In the paper we present the new approach to Kolmogorov-Sinai entropy and its quantization. Our presentation stems from an application of the Choquet theory to the theory of decompositions of states and therefore, it resembles our rigorous description of entanglement of formation

entry.title: WITHDRAWN: Adiabatic charge transport and the Kubo formula for 2D Hall conductance
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors, due to an error in the proof of Lemma 3.1.

entry.title: On the classification of subalgebras of Cend_N and gc_N
entry.summary: The problem of classification of infinite subalgebras of Cend_N and of gc_N that acts irreducibly on $\Bbb C[\partial]^N$ is discussed in this paper.

entry.title: On a Factorization of Symmetric Matrices and Antilinear Symmetries
entry.summary: We present a simple proof of the factorization of (complex) symmetric matrices into a product of a square matrix and its transpose, and discuss its application in establishing a uniqueness property of certain antilinear operators.

entry.title: Discrete spectral triples converging to dirac operators
entry.summary: We exhibit some series of discrete spectral triples converging to the canonical spectral triple of a finite dimensional manifold. Thus the non-go theorem of Goekeler and Schuecker is reasonably bypassed.

entry.title: On eigenvalues of discrete Schrödinger operators with potentials of Coulomb type decay
entry.summary: We study the distribution of the eigenvalues inside of the essential spectrum for discrete one-dimensional Schr\"odinger operators with potentials of Coulomb type decay.

entry.title: Jacobi fields of completely integrable Hamiltonian systems
entry.summary: We show that Jacobi fields of a completely integrable Hamiltonian system of m degrees of freedom also make up a completely integrable system. They provide m additional first integrals which characterize a relative motion.

entry.title: p-Adic representation of the Cuntz algebra and the free coherent states
entry.summary: Representation of the Cuntz algebra in the space of (complex valued) functions on p-adic disk is introduced. The relation of this representation and the free coherent states is investigated.

entry.title: Mean-Field Approximation of Quantum Systems and Classical Limit
entry.summary: We prove that, for a smooth two-body potentials, the quantum mean-field approximation to the nonlinear Schroedinger equation of the Hartree type is stable at the classical limit h \to 0, yielding the classical Vlasov equation.

entry.title: Discrete Polynomials and Discrete Holomorphic Approximation
entry.summary: We use discrete holomorphic polynomials to prove that, given a refining sequence of critical maps of a Riemann surface, any holomorphic function can be approximated by a converging sequence of discrete holomorphic functions.

entry.title: Exactly solvable periodic Darboux q-chains
entry.summary: A difference q-analogue of the dressing chain is discussed in this paper.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, LaTeX, to appear in Russian Math. Surveys

entry.title: On Local Perturbations of SCHRÖdinger Operator on Plane
entry.summary: We obtain necessary and sufficient conditions for emerging of small eigenvalue for Schr\"odinger operator on plane under local operator perturbations. In the case the eigenvalue emerges we construct its asymptotics. The examples are given.

entry.title: On quantizing semisimple basic algebras II: The general case
entry.summary: We prove that there is no consistent polynomial quantization of the coordinate ring of a basic non-nilpotent coadjoint orbit of a semisimple Lie group.

entry.title: A few comments on N=2 supersymmetric Landau-Ginzburg theories
entry.summary: In present note I give two new examples of Landau-Ginzburg theories considered in detail in recent paper by Cecotti and Vafa

entry.title: Exponentials form a basis of discrete holomorphic functions
entry.summary: We show that discrete exponentials form a basis of discrete holomorphic functions. On a convex, the discrete polynomials form a basis as well.

entry.title: Distributional Borel Summability for Vacuum Polarization by an External Electric Field
entry.summary: It is proved that the divergent perturbation expansion for the vacuum polarization by an external constant electric field in the pair production sector is Borel summable in the distributional sense.

entry.title: A weaker geodesic completeness and Clifton-Pohl torus
entry.summary: We propose a new definition of geodesic completeness, based on analytical continuation in the complex domain: we apply this idea to Clifton-Pohl torus, relating, for each geodesic, completeness to the value of a function of initial conditions, called 'impulse'.

entry.title: Real Commuting Differential Operators Connected with Two-Dimensional Abelian Varieties
entry.summary: We indicate smooth real commuting matrix differential operators whose eigenvalues and eigenfunctions are parametrized by two-dimensional principally polarized abelian varieties.

entry.title: Commutative Rings of Differential Operators Corresponding to Multidimensional Algebraic Varieties
entry.summary: We construct new examples of multidimensional commuting matrix differential operators and a multidimensional analog of the Kadomtsev--Petviashvili hierarchy.

entry.title: Dirac-type tensor equations on a parallelisable manyfolds
entry.summary: The goal of this work is to extend Dirac-type tensor equations to a curved space. We take four 1-forms (a tetrad) as a unique structure, which determines a geometry of space-time.

entry.title: The Dirac equation vs. the Dirac type tensor equation
entry.summary: We discuss a connection between the Dirac equation for an electron and the Dirac type tensor equation with ${\rm U}(1)$ gauge symmetry.

entry.title: P.S. to the paper "Dirac type tensor equations with nonabelian gauge symmetries on pseudo-Riemannian space"
entry.summary: We improve the concept of our previous paper "Dirac type tensor equations with nonabelian gauge symmetries on pseudo-Riemannian space" and present a new compact formula for the tensor $B_\mu$.

entry.title: Analyticity of the density of electronic wavefunctions
entry.summary: We prove that the electronic densities of atomic and molecular eigenfunctions are real analytic in ${\mathbb R}^3$ away from the nuclei.

entry.title: A concept of Dirac-type tensor equations
entry.summary: Considering a four dimensional parallelisable manifold, we develop a concept of Dirac-type tensor equations with wave functions that belong to left ideals of the set of nonhomogeneous complex valued differential forms.

entry.title: Reply to the Comment 'On large-N expansion'
entry.summary: Fernandez Comment [1] on our pseudo-perturbative shifted-l expansion technique [2,3] is either unfounded or ambiguous.

entry.title: The Cauchy problem for the semilinear quintic Schrödinger equation in one dimension,the defocusing case
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: The Singularity of Kontsevich's Solution for $QH^{*}(CP^2)$
entry.summary: We study the singularity of the Kontsevich's solution of the WDVV equations of associativity. We prove that it corresponds to a singularity in the change of two coordinates systems of the Frobenius manifold given by the quantum cohomology of $CP^2$.

entry.title: Erratum: Pseudo-Hermiticity for a class of nondiagonalizable Hamiltonians [J. Math. Phys. 43, 6343 (2002); math-ph/0207009]
entry.summary: An error in the paper [J. Math. Phys. 43, 6343 (2002); math-ph/0207009] is corrected. Further explanation is given.

entry.title: Dynamical systems where time is a quantum group and quantum ergodicity
entry.summary: We define dynamical systems where time is a quantum group. We give the definition of quantum ergodicity for the introduced dynamical system with noncommutative (or quantum) time, and discuss the examples.

entry.title: Monotonicity and Thermodynamic Limit for Short Range Disordered Models
entry.summary: If the variance of a short range Gaussian random potential grows like the volume its quenched thermodynamic limit is reached monotonically.

entry.title: Topological quantum numbers in the Hall effect
entry.summary: Topological quantum numbers account for the precise quantization that occurs in the integer Hall effect. In this theory, Kubo's formula for the conductance acquires a topological interpretation in terms of Chern numbers and their non-commutative analog, the Fredholm Indices.

entry.title: On the notion of a differential operator in noncommutative geometry
entry.summary: The algebraic notion of a differential operator on a module over a commutative ring is not extended to a module over a noncommutative ring.

entry.title: Affine Weyl group approach to Painlevé equations
entry.summary: An overview is given on recent developments in the affine Weyl group approach to Painlev\'e equations and discrete Painlev\'e equations, based on the joint work with Y. Yamada and K. Kajiwara.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the ICM, Beijing 2002, vol. 3, 497--510

entry.title: Geometric tools of the adiabatic complex WKB method
entry.summary: The paper is devoted to the description of the main geometric and analytic tools of a complex WKB method for adiabatic problem. We illustrate their use by numerous examples.

entry.title: Gravitational potential energy group theoretically
entry.summary: We show by symplectically realizing the one spatial Aristotle Lie group that the hamiltonian of the associated elementary system consist of a gravitational energy only. No kinetic term.

entry.title: Erratum: Instantaneous frequency and amplitude identification using wavelets: Application to glass structure
entry.summary: Typographical corrections to the original paper, intended for publication in Physical Review E.

entry.title: Jackson's q-exponential as the exponential of a series
entry.summary: Jackson's q-exponential is expressed as the exponential of a series whose coefficients are obtained in closed form. Such a relation is used to derive some properties of the q-exponential.

entry.title: Magnetostriction Transition
entry.summary: We present a non mean-field model which undergoes a magnetostriction phase transition in the temperature. That is, the crystal becomes sharply contracted and magnetized once the temperature passes below the critical value

entry.title: Dynamics of granular gases
entry.summary: A complete theory for the dynamics of granular gases is presented. A balance equation involving a stirring tensor and ruling the evolution of Reynold's tensor accrues in addition to the continuity equation and the standard Cauchy's balance. Special flows are discussed explicitly.

entry.title: Tunneling effects between tori in double wells
entry.summary: We consider tunneling between 2 symmetric potential wells for a 2-d Schrodinger operator, in the case of eigenvalues associated with quasi-modes supported on KAM or Birkhoff tori.
entry.arxiv:comment: to be presented as a poster in the session Quantum Mechanics and Spectral Theory, IAMP, 2003

entry.title: Construction of Lie Superalgebras from Triple Product Systems
entry.summary: Any simple Lie superalgebras over the complex field can be constructed from some triple systems. Examples of Lie superalgebras $D(2,1;\alpha)$, G(3) and F(4) are given by utilizing a general construction method based upon $(-1,-1)$ balanced Freudenthal-Kantor triple system.

entry.title: Pendulum View of The Schroedinger Equation
entry.summary: A transformation is found between the one dimensional Schroedinger equation and a pendulum problem. It is demonstrated how to construct exact solutions with the resulted pendulum equation. The relation of this transformation to the Zakharov-Shabat equations is pointed out.

entry.title: Notions of determinant, spectrum, and Hermitian conjugation of Clifford algebra elements
entry.summary: We show how the matrix algebra notions of determinant, spectrum, and Hermitian conjugation transfer to the Clifford algebra and to differential forms on parallelisable manifolds.

entry.title: Generally covariant Quantum Mechanics
entry.summary: We present a complete theory, which is a generalization of Bargmann's theory of factors for ray representations. We apply the theory to the generally covariant formulation of the Quantum Mechanics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, presented at the Symmetry 2003 conference in Kiev

entry.title: Erratum to: Canonical coherent states for the relativistic harmonic oscillator
entry.summary: The expression for $\hat{\kappa}$ in J. Math. Phys. 36, 3191 (1995) was miswritten. The correct expression is given.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex, 1 page. Erratum to J. Math. Phys. 36, 3191 (1995)

entry.title: Linear Hilbertian manifold domains
entry.summary: Necessary and sufficient conditions for a dense subspace of a Hilbert space to be a linear Hilbertian manifold domain are given. Some relations between linear Hilbertian manifold domains and domains of self-adjoint operators are found.

entry.title: On the smoothness of gap boundaries for generalized Harper operators
entry.summary: Results concerning set theoretic continuity properties of the spectrum of the Harper operator are extended to a large class (generalized Harper operators (GHO)) of operators in $L^{2}(\bZ^{2})$.

entry.title: On the absolutely continuous spectrum of Dirac operator
entry.summary: We prove that the massless Dirac operator in $\mathbb{R^3}$ with long-range potential has an a.c. spectrum which fills the whole real line. The Dirac operators with matrix-valued potentials are considered as well.

entry.title: Obstructions, Extensions and Reductions. Some applications of Cohomology
entry.summary: After introducing some cohomology classes as obstructions to orientation and spin structures etc., we explain some applications of cohomology to physical problems, in special to reduced holonomy in M- and F-theory.

entry.title: Separation of variables and Lie algebra contractions. Applications to special functions
entry.summary: A review is given of some recently obtained results on analytic contractions of Lie algebras and Lie groups and their applications to special function theory.

entry.title: A Criterion for Ferromagnetism in the Isotropic Quantum Heisenberg Model
entry.summary: A criterion for ferromagnetism is presented suggesting a line of proof to rigorously establish the phase transition. Spectral information will be required in certain invariant subspaces of the Hamiltonian, hopefully the relatively crude estimates needed will be not too difficult to establish.

entry.title: The group classification of one class of nonlinear wave equations
entry.summary: The problem of group classification of one class of quasilinear equations of hyperbolic type with two independent variables has been solved completely.

entry.title: Number Operator Algebras and generalizations of supersymmetry
entry.summary: Several quantum systems have been used in the last few years to extend supersymmetry. In this paper we show all this systems fit into the picture of what we call "Number Operator Algebras".

entry.title: Conditionally exactly solvable potential and dual transformation in quantum mechanics
entry.summary: We comment that the conditionally exactly solvable potential of Dutt et al. and the exactly solvable potential from which it is derived form a dual system.

entry.title: The inverse crime
entry.summary: The inverse crime occurs when the same (or very nearly the same) theoretical ingredients are employed to synthesize as well as to invert data in an inverse problem. This act has been qualified as trivial and therefore to be avoided by Colton and Kress.

entry.title: Matrix Revolutions, The Origin of Quantum Variables
entry.summary: An informal guide to the history of Heisenberg's matrix mechanics. It is designed for mathematicians with only a minimal background in either physics or geometry, and it is based upon Heisenberg's original arguments.

entry.title: Hyper-elliptic Nambu flow associated with integrable maps
entry.summary: We study hyper-elliptic Nambu flows associated with some $n$ dimensional maps and show that discrete integrable systems can be reproduced as flows of this class.

entry.title: On regular and singular perturbations of acoustic and quantum waveguides
entry.summary: We consider regular and singular perturbations of the Dirichlet and Neumann boundary value problems for the Helmholtz equation in $n$-dimensional cylinders. Existence of eigenvalues and their asymptotics are studied.

entry.title: Yang-Mills Theory for Noncommutative Flows
entry.summary: Shown is a new duality for the moduli spaces of Yang-Mills connections over noncommutative vector bundles, using which one sees that total data of quantum field theory are preserved by dimension reduction.

entry.title: On the inverse scattering approach to the Camassa-Holm equation
entry.summary: A simple algorithm for the inverse scattering approach to the Camassa-Holm equation is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: Archive version is already official. Published by JNMP at http://www.sm.luth.se/math/JNMP/
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: J. Nonlinear Math. Phys., volume 10, no. 3 (2003) 252-255

entry.title: Parametrized vector fields and the zero-curvature condition
entry.summary: We apply the notion of parametrized vector field on a manifold M, where the parameters are also in M, to the study of the zero-curvature condition that arises in the context of integrable systems.

entry.title: Differential-geometric and topological structure of multidimensional Delsarte transmutation operators
entry.summary: A differential geometrical and topological structure of Delsarte transmutation operators in multidimension is studied, the relationships with De Rham-Hodge-Skrypnik theory of generalized differential complexes is stated.

entry.title: On the self-similarities of the Penrose tiling
entry.summary: We show that the well known two-dimensional Penrose tiling admits an infinite number of independent scaling factors and an infinite number of inflation centers.

entry.title: On positive maps, entanglement and quantization
entry.summary: We outline the scheme for quantization of classical Banach space results associated with some prototypes of dynamical maps and describe the quantization of correlations as well. A relation between these two areas is discussed.

entry.title: Lifshitz tails for the 1D Bernoulli-Anderson model
entry.summary: By using the adequate modified Pr\"ufer variables, precise upper and lower bounds on the density of states in the (internal) Lifshitz tails are proven for a 1D Anderson model with bounded potential.

entry.title: Generalized Hamilton-Jacobi equations for nonholonomic dynamics
entry.summary: Employing a suitable nonlinear Lagrange functional, we derive generalized Hamilton-Jacobi equations for dynamical systems subject to linear velocity constraints. As long as a solution of the generalized Hamilton-Jacobi equation exists, the action is actually minimized (not just extremized).

entry.title: Algebraic spectral relations for elliptic quantum Calogero-Moser problems
entry.summary: Explicit algebraic relations between the quantum integrals of the elliptic Calogero-Moser quantum problems related to the root systems A_2 and B_2 are found.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Journal of Nonlinear Mathematical Physics 6 (3), pp. 263-268, (1999)

entry.title: A short note about Morozov's formula
entry.summary: The purpose of this short note, is to rewrite Morozov's formula for correlation functions over the unitary group, in a much simpler form, involving the computation of a single determinant.

entry.title: Quantum integrability of the deformed elliptic Calogero-Moser problem
entry.summary: The integrability of the deformed quantum elliptic Calogero-Moser problem introduced by Chalykh, Feigin and Veselov is proven. Explicit recursive formulae for the integrals are found. For integer values of the parameter this implies the algebraic integrability of the systems.

entry.title: Global Small Solutions of the Vlasov-Norstrom System
entry.summary: The Vlasov-Nordstrom system is a relativistic model for the description of a self-gravitating collisionless gas. In this paper we show, using a bootstrap argument, that classical small solutions of the Vlasov-Nordstrom system exist globally in time.

entry.title: Cohomology groups for Lagrange complexes that are invariant under a pseudogroup of local transformations
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a crucial error in formula 4.12.r

entry.title: A hyper-geometric approach to the BMV-conjecture
entry.summary: We provide a representation of the (signed) BMV-measure by stochastic means and prove positivity of the respective measures in dimension $d=3$ in several non-trivial cases by combinatorial methods.

entry.title: S. S. Chern and Chern-Simons Terms
entry.summary: Some properties of Chern-Simons terms are presented and their physical utility is surveyed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Title changed, text edited for Chern Memorial

entry.title: Taylor expansion for an operator function
entry.summary: A simple version for the extension of the Taylor theorem to the operator functions was found. The expansion was done with respect to a value given by a diagonal matrix for the non-commutative case, and the coefficients are given both by recurrence relations and Cauchy integrals.

entry.title: Semidirect product reduction theory: a user's guide
entry.summary: Here we carry out computations that help clarify the Lagrangian and Hamiltonian structure of compressible flow. The intent is to be pedagogical and rigorous, providing concrete examples of the theory outlined in Holm, Marsden, and Ratiu [1998] and Marsden, Ratiu, and Weinstein [1984].

entry.title: Appendix to paper: A geometric level-set formulation of a plasma-sheath interface
entry.summary: In this paper, we present appendices employed in the paper "A geometric level-set formulation of a plasma-sheath interface" by the authors.

entry.title: Existence of triangular Lie bialgebra structures II
entry.summary: We characterize finite-dimensional Lie algebras over an arbitrary field of characteristic zero which admit a non-trivial (quasi-) triangular Lie bialgebra structure.

entry.title: Robertson-Schrödinger intelligent states for two-body Calogero model
entry.summary: Using the Gazeau-Klauder and Klauder-Perelomov coherent states, we derive the Robertson-Schr\"odinger intelligent states for two-body Calogero quantum system.

entry.title: Regularities of ground states of quantum field models
entry.summary: Regularities and higher order regularities of ground states of quantum field models are investigated through the fact that asymptotic annihilation operators vanish ground states. Moreover a sufficient condition for the absence of a ground state is given.

entry.title: Determinant Formulae for some Tiling Problems and Application to Fully Packed Loops
entry.summary: We present determinant formulae for the number of tilings of various domains in relation with Alternating Sign Matrix and Fully Packed Loop enumeration.

entry.title: A note on the kinematics of dislocations in crystals
entry.summary: A part of the theory of dislocations in crystals is revised with the aim to fit it into the framework of the nonlinear theory of plasticity initially designed for amorphous glassy materials.

entry.title: Poisson Hypothesis for Information Networks II. Cases of Violations and Phase Transitions
