entry.summary: We present examples of queuing networks that never come to equilibrium. That is achieved by constructing Non-linear Markov Processes, which are non-ergodic, and possess eternal transience property.

entry.title: The fine gradings of sl(3,C) and their symmetries
entry.summary: We describe the normalizers for all non-conjugate maximal Abelian subgroups of diagonalizable automorphisms of sl(3,C) and show their relation to the symmetries of equations related to the graded contraction.

entry.title: Asymptotic Stability of Nonlinear Schrödinger Equations with Potential
entry.summary: We prove asymptotic stability of trapped solitons in the generalized nonlinear Schr\"odinger equation with a potential in dimension 1 and for even potential and even initial conditions.

entry.title: Classical solutions of the degenerate Garnier system and their coalescence structures
entry.summary: We study the degenerate Garnier system which generalizes the fifth Painlev\'{e} equation. We present two classes of particular solutions, classical transcendental and algebraic ones. Their coalescence structure is also investigated.

entry.title: Functional Equations and the Generalised Elliptic Genus
entry.summary: We give a new derivation and characterisation of the generalised elliptic genus of Krichever-H\"ohn by means of a functional equation.
entry.arxiv:comment: To be published in the collection honouring Francesco Calogero's 70-th birthday

entry.title: Conjecture on a classification criterion for holonomies for the U(1) group
entry.summary: Our main goal is to find a criterion to classify if a given group have a structure similar to a U(1) Lie group.

entry.title: Computing Hodge integrals with one lambda-class
entry.summary: Any hodge integrals involving psi-classes and one lambda-class is computed as a polynomial in terms of lower-dimensional ones. Algorithm and examples are presented.

entry.title: Representing Euclidean quantum fields as scaling limit of particle systems
entry.summary: We give a new representation of Euclidean quantum fields as scaling limits of systems of interacting, continuous, classical particles in the grand canonical ensemble.

entry.title: Nonclassical symmetry and Riemann invariants
entry.summary: In this paper it is shown that Riemann invariants are invariant under nonclassical symmetries of a hyperbolic system. As a specific example, we study the one-dimensional shallow water equations on the flat and present another type invariance under nonclassical symmetries.

entry.title: On the geometry of a dislocated medium
entry.summary: Purely real space versions of the differential equations describing the kinematics of a dislocated crystalline medium are considered. The differential geometric structures associated with them are revealed.

entry.title: A class of completely integrable quantum systems associated with classical root systems
entry.summary: We classify the completely integrable systems associated with classical root systems whose potential functions are meromorphic at an infinite point.

entry.title: Lambda and mu-symmetries
entry.summary: Lambda-symmetries of ODEs were introduced by Muriel and Romero, and discussed by C. Muriel in her talk at SPT2001. Here we provide a geometrical characterization of lambda-prolongations, and a generalization of these -- and of lambda-symmetries -- to PDEs and systems thereof.

entry.title: The Falicov-Kimball model
entry.summary: This is a review for Elsevier's Encyclopedia of mathematical physics.

entry.title: On the averages of characteristic polynomials from classical groups
entry.summary: We provide an elementary and self-contained derivation of formulae for products and ratios of characteristic polynomials from classical groups using classical results due to Weyl and Littlewood.

entry.title: Determination of the shape of the ear channel
entry.summary: It is proved that the measurement of the acoustic pressure on the ear membrane allows one to determine the shape of the ear channel uniquely.

entry.title: On localization of pseudo-relativistic energy
entry.summary: We present a Kato-type inequality for bounded domain Omega \subset R^n, n>1.

entry.title: Simplicity of eigenvalues in the Anderson model
entry.summary: We give a simple, transparent, and intuitive proof that all eigenvalues of the Anderson model in the region of localization are simple.

entry.title: Fermion to Boson Mapping
entry.summary: The enveloping algebra,$D_{n}$,of fermions is extended on the lattice to include the discrete space invariance.This extended algebra,denoted X, has the space symmetry as a factor : $X/D_{n}$ = space group.

entry.title: The Dirac Monopole and Differential Characters
entry.summary: We describe the Dirac monopole using the Cheeger-Simons differential characters. We comment on the r\^{o}le of the Dirac string and on the connection with Deligne cohomology.

entry.title: Quasiperiodic packings of two-shell decagonal clusters
entry.summary: We present some mathematical results concerning the strip projection method and a computer program for generating quasiperiodic packings of decagonal two shell-clusters.
entry.arxiv:comment: Computer program in FORTRAN + MATHEMATICA included

entry.title: Velocity addition in Special Relativity and in Newtonian Mechanics are isomorphic
entry.summary: In the one dimensional case, velocity addition in Special Relativity and in Newtonian Mechanics, respectively, are each a commutative group operation, and the two groups are isomorphic. There are infinitely many such isomorphisms, each indexed by one positive real parameter.

entry.title: A recursive parameterisation of unitary matrices
entry.summary: A simple recursive scheme for parameterisation of n-by-n unitary matrices is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: Notations simplified and more details given

entry.title: A topological version of Levinson's theorem
entry.summary: In the framework of scattering theory, we show how the scattering matrix can be related to the projection on the bound states by an index map of K-theory. Pairings with appropriate cyclic cocyles lead naturally to a topological version of Levinson's theorem.

entry.title: Spectral theory and distributional Borel summability for the quantum Hénon-Heiles model
entry.summary: The Borel summability in the distributional sense is established of the divergent perturbation theory for the ground state resonance of the quantum H\'enon-Heiles model.

entry.title: The Exact Renormalization Group
entry.summary: This is a very brief introduction to Wilson's Renormalization Group with emphasis on mathematical developments.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, AMS LaTeX. Contribution to the Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics (Elsevier, 2006). Typos, journal reference corrected

entry.title: Quantum Complex Minkowski Space
entry.summary: The complex Minkowski phase space has the physical interpretation of the phase space of the scalar massive conformal particle. The aim of the paper is the construction and investigation of the quantum complex Minkowski space.

entry.title: The Ghirlanda-Guerra Identities
entry.summary: If the variance of a Gaussian spin-glass Hamiltonian grows like the volume the model fulfills the Ghirlanda-Guerra identities in terms of the normalized Hamiltonian covariance.

entry.title: Out of equilibrium correlations in the XY chain
entry.summary: We study the transversal XY spin-spin correlations in the non-equilibrium steady state constructed in \cite{AP03} and prove their spatial exponential decay close to equilibrium.

entry.title: The stochastic acceleration problem in two dimensions
entry.summary: We consider the motion of a particle in a two-dimensional spatially homogeneous mixing potential and show that its momentum converges to the Brownian motion on a circle. This complements the limit theorem of Kesten and Papanicolaou \cite{KP} proved in dimensions $d\ge 3$.

entry.title: Reduction of su(N) loop tensors to trees
entry.summary: We present a systematic method to express all $su(N)$ invariant tensors in terms of forests i.e. products of tree tensors.

entry.title: Existence of Spontaneous Pair Creation
entry.summary: A prove of the existence of spontaneous pair creation as an external field problem in second quantized Dirac theory. PHD Thesis

entry.title: Conformal Field Theories on the Two-Torus and Quotients of SL2(Z)
entry.summary: We present remarkable properties of the groups SL2(Z/NZ) which might be useful in detailed studies of some quotients appearing in Conformal Field Theories.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, dedicated to the memory of C. Itzykson

entry.title: Mock (False) Theta Functions as Quantum Invariants
entry.summary: We show a correspondence between the SU(2) Witten--Reshetikhin--Turaev invariant for the Seifert manifold M(p,q,r) and Ramanujan's mock theta functions.

entry.title: Distribution of particles which produces a desired radiation pattern
entry.summary: A method is given for calculation of a distribution of small particles, embedded in a medium, so that the resulting medium would have a desired radiation pattern for the plane wave scattering by this medium.

entry.title: A Remark on the Strict Positivity of the Entropy Production
entry.summary: We establish an algebraic criterion which ensures the strict positivity of the entropy production in quantum models consisting of a small system coupled to thermal reservoirs at different temperatures.

entry.title: Algebraic identities associated with KP and AKNS hierarchies
entry.summary: Explicit KP and AKNS hierarchy equations can be constructed from a certain set of algebraic identities involving a quasi-shuffle product.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, proceedings of Integrable Systems 2005, Prague

entry.title: Liouville and logarithmic actions in Laplacian growth
entry.summary: We discuss and construct an action functional (logarithmic action) for the simply connected Laplacian growth and obtain its variation. This variation admits various interpretations. In particular, we consider a general smooth subordination evolution and give connections with the Virasoro algebra and Neretin polynomials.

entry.title: Clifford algebras, spinors and fundamental interactions : Twenty Years After
entry.summary: This is a short review of the algebraic properties of Clifford algebras and spinors. Their use in the description of fundamental physics (elementary particles) is also summarized. Lecture given at the ICCA7 conference, Toulouse (23/05/2005)

entry.title: Constructive Quantum Field Theory
entry.summary: A review of the renormalization group approach to the proof of non perturbative ultraviolet stability in scalar field theories in dimension d=2,3.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics}, ed. J.P. Francoise, G.L. Naber, Tsou Sheung Tsun, Vol. 1, 617--630, 2006, Elsevier

entry.title: Realizations of real semisimple low-dimensional Lie algebras
entry.summary: A complete set of inequivalent realizations of three- and four-dimensional real unsolvable Lie algebras in vector fields on a space of an arbitrary (finite) number of variables is obtained.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of Institute of Mathematics, Kyiv, 2005, V.55, 163-168

entry.title: Random matrices and determinantal processes
entry.summary: We survey recent results on determinantal processes, random growth, random tilings and their relation to random matrix theory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 40 pages. Lectures given at the summer school on Mathematical statistical mechanics in July 05 at Ecole de Physique, Les Houches

entry.title: Discrete models of the self-dual and anti-self-dual equations
entry.summary: In the case of a gauge-invariant discrete model of Yang-Mills theory difference self-dual and anti-self-dual equations are constructed.

entry.title: Euclidean Field Theory
entry.summary: A coincise review about Euclidean (Quantum) Field Theory is presented. It deals with the general structural properties, the connections with Quantum Field Theory, the exploitation in Constructive Quantum Field Theory, and the physical interpretation.

entry.title: Complex Eigenfrequencies of Some Axially Symmetrical Bodies
entry.summary: The complex eigenfrequencies of a perfectly conducting cone, truncated cone, and finite circular cylinder are determined using the time-domain integral equation method and the Prony technique.

entry.title: Wave propagation through sparse potential barriers
entry.summary: We prove that 3-dimensional Schrodinger operator with slowly decaying sparse potential has an a.c. spectrum that fills positive half-line. A new kind of WKB asymptotics for Green's function is found. The absense of positive eigenvalues is established as well.

entry.title: Absolutely continuous spectrum for the Anderson model on a tree: a geometric proof of Klein's theorem
entry.summary: We give a new proof of a version of Klein's theorem on the existence of absolutely continuous spectrum for the Anderson model on the Bethe Lattice at weak disorder.

entry.title: Recent Results on Non--Adiabatic Transitions in Quantum Mechanics
entry.summary: We review mathematical results concerning exponentially small corrections to adiabatic approximations and Born--Oppenheimer approximations.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the proceedings of the 2005 International Conference on Differential Equations and Mathematical Physics, University of Alabama, Birmingham

entry.title: Curves and The Photon
entry.summary: The study of the number of photons leads to a new way of characterizing curves and to a novel integral invariant over curves.
entry.arxiv:comment: Presented at PHOTON 2005, Warsaw, Sept 2005 Five pages,one figure

entry.title: Recent Progress in Quantum Spin Systems
entry.summary: Some recent developments in the theory of quantum spin systems are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Markov Processes and Related Fields (J.T. Lewis special edition)
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Markov Processes Rel. Fields (J.T. Lewis special edition), 13 (2007) 315-329

entry.title: Renormalization Group versus Kolmogorov-Sinai entropy: a very simple remark
entry.summary: A very simple remark concerning a link between the notions of Kolmogorov-Sinai entropy and of Renormalization Group is performed.

entry.title: A Gröenewald Van Hove like formulation of the ordering problems of General Relativity
entry.summary: A simple formal recasting of well known arguments concerning the ordering problems of General Relativity allows to obtain in such a context a Gr\"{o}enewald Van Hove like theorem.

entry.title: On implementability of Bogoliubov automorphisms and the white noise distribution theory for the Fermion system
entry.summary: In this paper, we consider Bogoliubov automorphisms of CAR algebra and we give implementers as continuous linear operators on the white noise (test or generalized) functionals for the Fermion system with the help of the Fock expansion.

entry.title: Construction of Generalized Connections
entry.summary: We present a construction method for mappings between generalized connections, comprising, e.g., the action of gauge transformations, diffeomorphisms and Weyl transformations. Moreover, criteria for continuity and measure preservation are stated.

entry.title: Pinning complex Networks by A Simple Controller
entry.summary: In this short paper, we point out that a single local stability controller can pin the complex network to a specified solution (or its equilibrium) of the coupled complex network. A rigorous mathematical proof is given, too.

entry.title: The sixth Painleve equation arising from Drinfel'd-Sokolov hierarchy
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors due to double submitting.

entry.title: The sixth Painleve equation arising from D_4^{(1)} hierarchy
entry.summary: The sixth Painleve equation arises from a Drinfel'd-Sokolov hierarchy associated with the affine Lie algebra of type D_4 by similarity reduction.

entry.title: Finite propagation speed and kernel estimates for Schrödinger operators
entry.summary: I point out finite propagation speed phenomena for discrete and continuous Schr\"odinger operators and discuss kernel estimates from this point of view.

entry.title: Random partitions and instanton counting
entry.summary: In this expository paper we summarize the connection between random partitions and 4-dimensional supersymmetric gauge theories discovered in hep-th/0306238. There is also a brief section about how this extends to 3-dimensional partitions which is best read together with math-ph/0412008.

entry.title: Notes on the equality in SSA of entropy on CAR algebra
entry.summary: We prove a necessary an sufficient condition for the states which satisfy strong subadditivity of von Neumann entropy with equality on CAR algebra and we show an example when the equality holds but the state is not separable.

entry.title: The Poincare'-Lyapounov-Nekhoroshev theorem for involutory systems of vector fields
entry.summary: We extend the Poincare'-Lyapounov-Nekhoroshev theorem from torus actions and invariant tori to general (non-abelian) involutory systems of vector fields and general invariant manifolds.

entry.title: Covariant Deformation Quantization of Free Fields
entry.summary: We define covariantly a deformation of a given algebra, then we will see how it can be related to a deformation quantization of a class of observables in Quantum Field Theory. Then we will investigate the operator order related to this deformation quantization.

entry.title: Superspinors
entry.summary: We propose to replace the classical Lorentz group with a compact semisimple Lie group. The results are rendered via the formalism of superspinors - objects identifiable as particles or antiparticles, and governed by the Fermi-Dirac statistics.

entry.title: 10-commutator and 13-commutator
entry.summary: Skew-symmetric sum of $N!$ compositions of $N$ vector fields in all possible order is called $N$-commutator. We construct 10-commutator and 13-commutator on a space of vector fields $Vect(3)$ and 10-commutator on a space of divergenceless vector fields $Vect_0(3).$

entry.title: Proof of the Variational Principle for a Pair Hamiltonian Boson Model
entry.summary: We give a two parameter variational formula for the grand-canonical pressure of the Pair Boson Hamiltonian model. By using the Approximating Hamiltonian Method we provide a rigorous proof of this variational principle.

entry.title: Re-formulation of combined system wave-function formalism
entry.summary: We introduce a formulation of combined systems in orthodox non-relativistic quantum mechanics, mathematically equivalent to the usual one. For context and larger issues, see http://euclid.unh.edu/~jjohnson/axiomatics.html and http://arxiv.org/quant-ph/0502124

entry.title: On critical stability of three quantum charges interacting through delta potentials
entry.summary: We consider three one dimensional quantum, charged and spinless particles interacting through delta potentials. We derive sufficient conditions which guarantee the existence of at least one bound state.

entry.title: Transformation Formula of the "2nd" Order Mock Theta Function
entry.summary: We give a transformation formula for the ``2nd order'' mock theta function which was recently proposed in connection with the quantum invariant for the Seifert manifold.

entry.title: The Discrete AKNS-D Hierarchy
entry.summary: In this paper, we consider the discrete AKNS-D hierarchy, find the construction of the hierarchy, prove the bilinear identity and give the construction of the $\tau$-functions of this hierarchy.

entry.title: Representations and Properties of Generalized $A_r$ Statistics
entry.summary: A generalization of $A_r$ statistics is proposed and developed. The generalized $A_r$ quantum statistics is completely specified by a set of Jacobson generators satisfying a set of triple algebraic relations. Fock-Hilbert representations and Bargmann-Fock realizations are derived.

entry.title: Many-body wave scattering by small bodies
entry.summary: Scattering problem by several bodies, small in comparison with the wavelength, is reduced to linear algebraic systems of equations, in contrast to the usual reduction to some integral equations.

entry.title: Moving frames applied to shell elasticity
entry.summary: Exterior calculus and moving frames are used to describe curved elastic shells. The kinematics follow from the Lie-derivative on forms whereas the dynamics via stress-forms.

entry.title: Perturbation theory of PT-symmetric Hamiltonians
entry.summary: In the framework of perturbation theory the reality of the perturbed eigenvalues of a class of $\PT$symmetric Hamiltonians is proved using stability techniques. We apply this method to $\PT$symmetric unperturbed Hamiltonians perturbed by $\PT$symmetric additional interactions.

entry.title: The Generalized Weierstrass System for Nonconstant Mean Curvature Surfaces and the Nonlinear Sigma Model
entry.summary: A study of the generalized Weierstrass system which can be used to induce mean curvature surfaces in three-dimensional Euclidean space is presented.

entry.title: Weakly coupled Schroedinger operators on regular metric trees
entry.summary: Spectral properties of the Schroedinger operator $A_{\lambda} = -\Delta +\lambda V$ on regular metric trees are studied. It is shown that as $\lambda$ goes to zero the behavior of the negative eigenvalues of $A_{\lambda}$ depends on the global structure of the tree.

entry.title: Spectral confinement and current for atoms in strong magnetic fields
entry.summary: We study confinement of the ground state of atoms in strong magnetic fields to different subspaces related to the lowest Landau band. The results obtained allow us to calculate the quantum current in the entire semiclassical region $B \ll Z^3$.

entry.title: On the Hadamard condition on Robertson-Walker spacetime
entry.summary: Using construction of adiabatic vacuum states of a free scalar field on Robertson-Walker spacetime, using results of Luders and Roberts we prove that validity of the Hadamard condition implies smoothness of the scale factor.

entry.title: Discrete path integral approach to the trace formula for regular graphs
entry.summary: We give a new proof of the trace formula for regular graphs. Our approach is inspired by path integral approach in quantum mechanics, and calculations are mostly combinatorial.

entry.title: Three Applications of Instanton Numbers
entry.summary: We use instanton numbers to: (i) stratify moduli of vector bundles, (ii) calculate relative homology of moduli spaces and (iii) distinguish curve singularities.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Communications in Mathematical Physics

entry.title: Rational solutions of Knizhnik-Zamolodchikov system
entry.summary: We consider Knizhnik-Zamolodchikov system of linear differential equations. The coefficients of this system are rational functions. We prove that under some conditions the solution of KZ system is rational too. This assertion confirms partially the conjecture of Chervov-Talalaev.

entry.title: Iterative solution of differential equations
entry.summary: We discuss alternative iteration methods for differential equations. We provide a convergence proof for exactly solvable examples and show more convenient formulas for nontrivial problems.

entry.title: Thermodynamics and Universality for Mean Field Quantum Spin Glasses
entry.summary: We study aspects of the thermodynamics of quantum versions of spin glasses. By means of the Lie-Trotter formula for exponential sums of operators, we adapt methods used to analyze classical spin glass models to answer analogous questions about quantum models.

entry.title: Functional Integration for Quantum Field Theory
entry.summary: The functional integration scheme for path integrals advanced by Cartier and DeWitt-Morette is extended to the case of fields. The extended scheme is then applied to quantum field theory. Several aspects of the construction are discussed.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Integr. Math. Theory Appl., Vol. 1(2008), No. 4, 279-299 (2010)

entry.title: Discrete analogues of the Dixmier operators
entry.summary: We construct discrete analogues of the Dixmier operators, that is, commuting difference operators corresponding to a spectral curve of genus 1 whose coefficients are polynomials of the discrete variable.

entry.title: Analysis of the second order exchange self energy of a dense electron gas
entry.summary: We investigate the evaluation of the six-fold integral representation for the second order exchange contribution to the self energy of a three dimensional electron gas at the Fermi surface.

entry.title: Approximation discret de la Densite d etat surfacique pour un operateur de Schrodinger surfacique presque periodique
entry.summary: On va montrer que la densite d etat surfacique de de l operateur de Schrodinger presque periodique discret converge faiblement vers la Densite d etat surfacique continue .

entry.title: Feynman Diagrams and Lax Pair Equations
entry.summary: We find a Lax pair equation corresponding to the Connes-Kreimer Birkhoff factorization of the character group of the Hopf algebra of Feynman diagrams. In particular, we obtain a flow for the character given by Feynman rules, and present a worked example.

entry.title: A new approach to the absorbing boundary conditions for the Schrödinger type equations
entry.summary: By the multiple-scale method some new approximate absorbing boundary conditions for the Schr\"odinger type equations are obtained.

entry.title: Assessment of the Shape of an Axisymmetrical Body from Complex Eigenfrequencies
entry.summary: Complex eigenfrequencies of the exterior of a scatterer are considered as signatures of the scatterer's shape. A parameter characterizing the ratio of the maximum transverse and longitudinal dimensions of a body is found.

entry.title: On Some Nonlinear Integral Equation in the (Super)String Theory
entry.summary: In this work some nonlinear integral equation is studied. This equation has arisen in the (super)string field theory and cosmology. In this work it is proved that some boundary problem for this equation has a solution.

entry.title: More on the Thomas precession and the relativistic transformation to rotating frames
entry.summary: We comment on some misunderstandings exhibited in a recent paper by Matolcsi et al. (Gen. Rel. Grav.39 413 (2007)).

entry.title: Form factor expansion of the row and diagonal correlation functions of the two dimensional Ising model
entry.summary: We derive and prove exponential and form factor expansions of the row correlation function and the diagonal correlation function of the two dimensional Ising model.

entry.title: Cartan's structure of symmetry pseudo-group and a covering for the modified Khokhlov-Zabolotskaya equation
entry.summary: We apply Cartan's method of equivalence to find a covering for the modified Khokhlov - Zabolotskaya equation.

entry.title: Spectral estimates for two-dimensional Schroedinger operators with application to quantum layers
entry.summary: A logarithmic type Lieb-Thirring inequality for two-dimensional Schroedinger operators is established. The result is applied to prove spectral estimates on trapped modes in quantum layers.

entry.title: Mass-sign duality of cubic oscillators
entry.summary: Two imaginary cubic anharmonic oscillators with the respective positive and negative mass term are shown isospectral.

entry.title: Remarks on geometry and the quantum potential
entry.summary: We gather material from many sources about the quantum potential and its geometric nature. The presentation is primarily expository but some new observations relating Q, V, and psi are indicated.
entry.arxiv:comment: 47 pages, Latex-some calculations corrected, some revision of interpretation

entry.title: Constrained evolution in Hilbert space and requantization
entry.summary: The quantum dynamics generated by time-dependent variational calculations is discussed from the perspective of geometric quantization. On examples, it is shown that approximate energy eigenstates can be associated to the quantized periodic orbits.

entry.title: Spin filtering on a ring with Rashba hamiltonian
entry.summary: We consider a quantum graph consisting of a ring with Rashba hamiltonian and an arbitrary number of semi-infinite wires attached. We describe the scattering matrix for this system and investigate spin filtering for a three terminal device.

entry.title: The Angular Momentum-Energy Space
entry.summary: In this paper we shall define and study the angular momentum-energy space for the classical problem of plane-motions of a particle situated in a potential field of a central force. We shall present the angular momentum-energy space for some important cases.

entry.title: Reciprocal Symmetry and the Origin of Spin
entry.summary: We have shown that Reciprocal Symmetric transformation shares the algebraic properties of Dirac Electron Theory more than Lorentz transformation and that the origin of spin is in Reciprocal Symmetry.

entry.title: Wave scattering by small particles in a medium
entry.summary: Wave scattering is considered in a medium in which many small particles are embedded. Equations for the effective field in the medium are derived when the number of particles tends to infinity.

entry.title: P(phi)_2 quantum field theories and Segal's axioms
entry.summary: We show that P(phi)_2 quantum field theories satisfy axioms of the type advocated by Graeme Segal.
entry.arxiv:comment: final version; to appear in Comm. Math. Phys

entry.title: Goldfish geodesics and Hamiltonian reduction of matrix dynamics
entry.summary: We relate free vector dynamics to the eigenvalue motion of a time-dependent real-symmetric NxN matrix, and give a geodesic interpretation to Ruijsenaars Schneider models.

entry.title: Bessel functions of integer order in terms of hyperbolic functions
entry.summary: Using Jacobi's identity we derive a simple expression for the Bessel functions of integer order in terms of combinations of powers and hyperbolic functions of the same argument.

entry.title: "Dressing" and Haag's theorem
entry.summary: It is demonstrated that the "dressed particle" approach to relativistic local quantum field theories does not contradict Haag's theorem. On the contrary, "dressing" is the way to overcome the difficulties revealed by Haag's theorem.

entry.title: On the Constructively Determination the Spectral Invariants of the Periodic Multidimensional Schrodinger Operator
entry.summary: In this paper we constructively determine a family of the spectral invariants of the multidimensional Schrodinger operator with a periodic potential by the given band functions.

entry.title: Some remarks on Ricci flow and the quantum potential
entry.summary: We indicate some formulas connecting Ricci flow and the Perelman entropy functional to Fisher information, differential entropy, and the quantum potential.
entry.arxiv:comment: some typos corrected and clarifications provided

entry.title: On The Even CAR Algebra
entry.summary: We exhibit a family of *-isomorphisms mapping the CAR algebra onto its even subalgebra.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, Latex, uses amssym.def and kluwer.sty, appears in Lett. Math. Phys

entry.title: Mean Field Approach to Quantum Duffing Oscillator
entry.summary: We propose a mean-field approach to the Duffing oscillator to construct perturbatively the bounded operators that generate the quantum states, and to define a non-Gaussian density operator.

entry.title: Unified Octonionic Representation of the 10-13 Dimensions Clifford Algebra
entry.summary: We give a one dimensional octonionic representation of the different Clifford algebra $Cliff(5,5)\sim Cliff(1,9), Cliff(6,6)\sim Cliff(2,10)$ and lastly $Cliff(7,6)\sim Cliff(3,10)$.

entry.title: Relativistic Pöschl-Teller and Rosen-Morse problems
entry.summary: It is shown that the new family of geometric models of the relativistic oscillator, which generalize the anti-de Sitter model, leads to relativistic P\"oschl-Teller or Rosen-Morse problems.

author.name: Ion I. Cot{\u}aescu
author.arxiv:affiliation: The West University of Timisoara, Romania

entry.title: The Supersymmetry of Relativistic Poschl-Teller Systems
entry.summary: We analyze the supersymmetry and the shape invariance of the potentials of the (1+1) relativistic oscillators we have recently proposed.

author.name: Ion I. Cotăescu
author.arxiv:affiliation: The West University of Timişoara, Romania

entry.title: Z_n^3-graded Poincare superalgebras
entry.summary: Using colored superanalysis and epsilon-Lie superalgebras, we build the minimal Poincare superalgebra in the case of the Z_n^3-grading. We then build a representation of this algebra, and the corresponding Poincare supergroup.

entry.title: Theory of hierarchical coupling
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn

entry.title: Spacetime Foliations and p-Brane Dynamics
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author. Proofs of two propositions need more details.
entry.arxiv:comment: 25 pages, LaTex. This paper has been withdrawn by the author. Proofs of two propositions need more details

entry.title: Conformal Field Theory and Operator Algebras
entry.summary: We review recent progress in operator algebraic approach to conformal quantum field theory. Our emphasis is on use of representation theory in classification theory. This is based on a series of joint works with R. Longo.
entry.arxiv:comment: For the Proceedings of ICMP (Rio de Janeiro, 2006).

entry.title: A Wegner estimate for multi-particle random Hamiltonians
entry.summary: We prove a Wegner estimate for a large class of multiparticle Anderson Hamiltonians on the lattice. These estimates will allow us to prove Anderson localization for such systems. A detailed proof of localization will be given in a subsequent paper.

entry.title: Explicit Green functions for spin-orbit Hamiltonians
entry.summary: We derive explicit expressions for Green functions and some related characteristics of the Rashba and Dresselhaus Hamiltonians with a uniform magnetic field.

entry.title: Higher-dimensional Temperley-Lieb algebras
entry.summary: A category which generalises to higher dimensions many of the features of the Temperley-Lieb category is introduced.

entry.title: Remarks related to the paper of Rafael de la Madrid: "On the inconsistency of the Bohm-Gadella theory with quantum mechanics", JPhysA 39, No. 29, 9255-9268 (2006)
entry.summary: The paper contains critical comments to the paper mentioned in the title from the mathematical point of view

entry.title: Generalized vector field
entry.summary: We define generalized vector fields, and contraction and Lie derivatives with respect to them. Generalized commutators are also defined.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk delivered by 3 pages, S.Chatterjee at at 17th DAE-BRNS High Energy Physics Symposium (HEP06), Kharagpur IIT, India, 11-16 Dec 2006

entry.title: Kepler Problem in the Constant Curvature Space
entry.summary: We present algebraic derivation of the result of Schr\"{o}dinger [1] for the spectrum of hydrogen atom in the space with constant curvature.

entry.title: A class of bi-Hamiltonian systems associated with deformed Reyman-Semenov-Tian-Shansky tensors
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn. The authors realized that the obtained results were not new.

entry.title: Exact treatment of linear difference equations with noncommutative coefficients
entry.summary: The exact solution of a Cauchy problem related to a linear second-order difference equation with constant noncommutative coefficients is reported.

entry.title: Two-dimensional Schroedinger operators with fast decaying potential and multidimensional $L_2$-kernel
entry.summary: Using Moutard transformations we show how explicit examples of two-dimensional Schroedinger operators with fast decaying potential and multidimensional $L_2$-kernel may be constructed

entry.title: Lieb--Thirring bounds for complex Jacobi matrices
entry.summary: We obtain various versions of classical Lieb--Thirring bounds for one- and multi-dimensional complex Jacobi matrices. Our method is based on Fan-Mirski Lemma and seems to be fairly general.

entry.title: KAM Theorem and Renormalization Group
entry.summary: We give an elementary proof of the analytic KAM theorem by reducing it to a Picard iteration of a PDE with quadratic nonlinearity, the so called Polchinski renormalization group equation studied in quantum field theory.

entry.title: Adeles in Mathematical Physics
entry.summary: Application of adeles in modern mathematical physics is briefly reviewed. In particular, some adelic products are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages. Invited talk at the international conference Actual Problems of Mathematics and Computer Modeling, 18-22 June 2007, Grodno, Belarus. To appear in the Proceedings

entry.title: Supersymmetry and Lie groups
entry.summary: We construct all vacuum states of $\mathcal{N}=2$ supersymmetric Yang-Mills quantum mechanics (for SU(N) group) and discuss their origin from the SU(N) real cohomology.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, to appear in Journal of Mathematical Physics

entry.title: Kepler problem in deformed (quantum) four-dimensional space in non relativistic limit with Galilei group of motion
entry.summary: It is shown that Kepler problem in deformed (quantum) four-dimensional space in non relativistic limit is integrable in quadratures. In non relativistic limit group of motion of quantum space coincide with Galilei one.

entry.title: Wegner bounds for a two-particle tight binding model
entry.summary: We consider a quantum two-particle system on a d-dimensional lattice with interaction and in presence of an IID external potential. We establish Wegner-typer estimates for such a model. The main tool used is Stollmann's lemma.

entry.title: Multiscale Analysis and Localization of Random Operators
entry.summary: A discussion of the method of multiscale analysis in the study of localization of random operators based on lectures given at \emph{Random Schr\"odinger operators: methods, results, and perspectives}, \'Etats de la recherche, Universit\'e Paris 13, June 2002

entry.title: Relative non-relativistic mechanics
entry.summary: Dynamic equations of non-relativistic mechanics are written in covariant-coordinate form in terms of relative velocities and accelerations with respect to an arbitrary reference frame. The notions of the non-relativistic reference frame, inertial force, free motion equation, and inertial frame are discussed.

entry.title: Gradings on $o(8,\mathbb C)$
entry.summary: This is a matricial description of all the fine group gradings on the exceptional Lie algebra $o(8,\mathbb C)$. There are fourteen.

entry.title: A two-parameter generalization of the complete elliptic integral of the second kind
entry.summary: The two parameter generalization of the complete elliptic integral of the second kind discussed recently by Barsan is expressed in terms of ordinary complete elliptic integrals.

entry.title: Symmetrized cut-join equation of Marino-Vafa formula
entry.summary: In this note, we symmetrized the cut-join equation from the proof of Marino-Vafa formula by applying a transcendental changing of variable. One can derive more recursion formulas of Hodge integrals out of this polynomial equations. We also give some applications.

entry.title: The Atiyah--Hitchin bracket for the cubic Nonlinear Schrodinger equation. IV. the scattering potentials
entry.summary: This is the last in a series of four papers on Poisson formalism for the cubic nonlinear Schrodinger equation with repulsive nonlinearity. In this paper we consider scattering potentials.

entry.title: On the neighbor spacing of eigenvalues of unitary matrices
entry.summary: We describe a subtle error which can appear in numerical calculations involving the spacing statistics of eigenvalues of random unitary matrices.

entry.title: Estimates on trapped modes in deformed quantum layers
entry.summary: We use a logarithmic Lieb-Thirring inequality for two-dimensional Schroedinger operators and establish estimates on trapped modes in geometrically deformed quantum layers.

entry.title: Flow of a non-Newtonian fluids on a flat plate: I. boundary layer
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors as requested by the journal.

entry.title: Ricci flow and quantum theory
entry.summary: We show some relations between Ricci flow and quantum theory via Fisher information and the quantum potential.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex, 7 pages, referrences added, results refined and expanded, typos corrected

entry.title: Inversion of perturbation series
entry.summary: We investigate the inversion of perturbation series and its resummation, and prove that it is related to a recently developed parametric perturbation theory. Results for some illustrative examples show that in some cases series reversion may improve the accuracy of the results.

entry.title: Symmetry preserving discretization of SL(2,R) invariant equations
entry.summary: Nonlinear ODEs invariant under the group SL(2,R) are solved numerically. We show that solution methods incorporating the Lie point symmetries provide better results than standard methods.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 3 figures, submitted to Journal of Nonlinear Mathematical Physics

entry.title: Central limit theorem for linear eigenvalue statistics of orthogonally invariant matrix models
entry.summary: We prove central limit theorem for linear eigenvalue statistics of orthogonally invariant ensembles of random matrices with one interval limiting spectrum. We consider ensembles with real analytic potentials and test functions with two bounded derivatives.

entry.title: Why Renormalizable NonCommutative Quantum Field Theories?
entry.summary: We complete our previous recent review on noncommutative field theory, discussing in particular the constructive aproach to the Grosse-Wulkenhaar theory. We also suggest that by gluing together many Grosse-Wulkenhaar theories at high energy one can obtain an effective commutative field theory at lower energy.

entry.title: Exactly Solvable Potentials by SO(2,2) Dynamical Algebra
entry.summary: The differential realization of the potential group SO(2,2) is used. The spectrum-generating algebra for a kind of exactly solvable potentials endowed with position-dependent mass is constructed.

entry.title: Accurate calculation of resonances in multiple-well oscillators
entry.summary: Quantum--mechanical multiple--well oscillators exhibit curious complex eigenvalues that resemble resonances in models with continuum spectra. We discuss a method for the accurate calculation of their real and imaginary parts.

entry.title: Ladder Operators for q-orthogonal Polynomials
entry.summary: The q-difference analog of the classical ladder operators is derived for those orthogonal polynomials arising from a class of indeterminate moments problem.

entry.title: A BV subtlety
entry.summary: The standard BV complex is never acyclic provided that the equations of motion have solutions and the admissible class of functions is general enough, unless one introduces second-order antifields. This phenomenon is explicitly illustrated for the harmonic oscillator and the free electromagnetic field.

entry.title: The renormalization of non commutative φ_4^{\star 4}
entry.summary: We present an overview of the different renormalization proofs of the non commutative $\phi_4^{\star 4}$ model. This paper is a contribution to the MemPhys project.
entry.arxiv:comment: Contribution to "The Modern Encyclopedia of Mathematical Physics (MEMPhys)" project

entry.title: Some open problems in random matrix theory and the theory of integrable systems
entry.summary: We describe a list of open problems in random matrix theory and integrable systems which was presented at the conference ``Integrable Systems, Random Matrices, and Applications'' at the Courant Institute in May 2006.

entry.title: The topological meaning of Levinson's theorem, half-bound states included
entry.summary: We propose to interpret Levinson's theorem as an index theorem. This exhibits its topological nature. It furthermore leads to a more coherent explanation of the corrections due to resonances at thresholds.

entry.title: Spectra and symmetric eigentensors of the Lichnerowicz Laplacian on $P^n(\comp)$
entry.summary: We compute the eigenvalues with multiplicities of the Lichnerowicz Laplacian acting on the space of complex symmetric covariant tensor fields on the complex projective space $P^n(\comp)$. The spaces of symmetric eigentensors are explicitly given.

entry.title: Nonlinear Stability of Riemann Ellipsoids with Symmetric Configurations
entry.summary: We apply geometric techniques to obtain the necessary and sufficient conditions on the existence and nonlinear stability of self-gravitating Riemann ellipsoids having at least two equal axes.

entry.title: Perturbation Theory for Population Dynamics
entry.summary: We prove that a recently proposed homotopy perturbation method for the treatment of population dynamics is just the Taylor expansion of the population variables about initial time. Our results show that this perturbation method fails to provide the global features of the ecosystem dynamics.

entry.title: Quasithermodynamics and a Correction to the Stefan--Boltzmann Law
entry.summary: We provide a correction to the Stefan--Boltzmann law and discuss the problem of a phase transition from the superfluid state into the normal state.

entry.title: Geometry of Quasi-Free States of CCR Algebras
entry.summary: Geometric positions of square roots of quasi-free states of CCR algebras are investigated together with an explicit formula for transition amplitudes among them.

entry.title: Scattering problem for the local parametric resonance equation
entry.summary: In this paper we present the solution of local parametric resonance equation in terms of parabolic cylinder functions and solve the scattering problem for this equation.

entry.title: "On the Impossibility of a Poincare-Invariant Vacuum State with Unit Norm" Refuted
entry.summary: Assertions made in a document recently deposited in the arXiv are refuted.
entry.arxiv:comment: Some comments with associated references have been added

entry.title: Aperiodic order and pure point diffraction
entry.summary: We give a leisurely introduction into mathematical diffraction theory with a focus on pure point diffraction. In particular, we discuss various characterisations of pure point diffraction and common models arising from cut and project schemes. We finish with a list of open problems.

entry.title: On pseudo-Hermitian operators with generalized $\mathcal{C}$-symmetries
entry.summary: The concept of $\mathcal{C}$-symmetries for pseudo-Hermitian Hamiltonians is studied in the Krein space framework. A generalization of $\mathcal{C}$-symmetries is suggested.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Modern analysis and applications. The Mark Krein Centenary Conference. Vol. 1: Operator theory and related topics, 375-385, (2009) Oper. Theory Adv. Appl., 190

entry.title: Large Deviations in Quantum Spin Chain
entry.summary: We show the full large deviation principle for KMS-states and $C^*$-finitely correlated states on a quantum spin chain. We cover general local observables. Our main tool is Ruelle's transfer operator method.

entry.title: Pointwise existence of the Lyapunov exponent for a quasi-periodic equation
entry.summary: In this short note, we describe some recent results on the pointwise existence of the Lyapunov exponent for certain quasi-periodic cocyles.

entry.title: Rational approximation to the Thomas--Fermi equation
entry.summary: We show that a simple and straightforward rational approximation to the Thomas--Fermi equation provides the slope at origin with unprecedented accuracy. We compare present approach with other available ones.

entry.title: Perturbative solutions to the extended constant scalar curvature equations on asymptotically hyperbolic manifolds
entry.summary: We prove local existence of solutions to the extended constant scalar curvature equations introduced by A. Butscher, in the asymptotically hyperbolic setting. This gives a new local construction of asymptotically hyperbolic metrics with constant scalar curvature.

entry.title: Electrodynamic spherical harmonic
entry.summary: Electrodynamic spherical harmonic is a second rank tensor in three-dimensional space. It allows to separate the radial and angle variables in vector solutions of Maxwell's equations. Using the orthonormalization for electrodynamic spherical harmonic, a boundary problem on a sphere can be easily solved.

entry.title: A realization of the quantum Lorentz group
entry.summary: A realization of a deformed Lorentz algebra is considered and its irreducible representations are found; in the limit $q\to 1$, these are precisely the irreducible representations of the classical Lorentz group.
entry.arxiv:comment: This a short version of the Phys.Lett.B publication

entry.title: Solution of a Linearized Model of Heisenberg's Fundamental Equation I
entry.summary: A linearized version of Heisenberg's fundamental equation is quantized by path integral method.

entry.title: Solution of a Linearized Model of Heisenberg's Fundamental Equation II
entry.summary: A linearized version of Heisenberg's fundamental equation is solved, and the solutions satisfy the axioms of a relativistic quantum field theory with a fundamental length.

entry.title: The Chebotarev-Gregoratti Hamiltonian as singular perturbation of a nonsemibounded operator
entry.summary: We derive the Hamiltonian associated to a quantum stochastic flow by extending the Albeverio-Kurasov construction of self-adjoint extensions to finite rank perturbations of nonsemibounded operators to Fock space.

entry.title: A nonlinear theory for shells with slowly varying thickness
entry.summary: We study the $\Gamma$-limit of 3d nonlinear elasticity for shells of small, variable thickness, around an arbitrary smooth 2d surface.

entry.title: Upper and lower bounds to the eigenvalues of an anharmonic oscillator
entry.summary: We obtain tight upper and lower bounds to the eigenvalues of an anharmonic oscillator with a rational potential. We compare our bounds with results given by other approaches.

entry.title: Hilbert Transform: A New Integral Formula
entry.summary: We give a number new examples analytically and numerically to confirm the Kohler conjecture. It turned out that for a rather large class of nonnegative functions the equality (A) hold.

entry.title: Electromagnetic wave scattering by many conducting small particles
entry.summary: A rigorous theory of electromagnetic (EM) wave scattering by small perfectly conducting particles is developed. The limiting case when the number of particles tends to infinity is discussed.

entry.title: Remarks on BMV conjecture
entry.summary: We show that for fixed $A,B$, hermitian nonnegative definite matrices, and fixed $k$ the coefficients of the $t^k$ in the polynomial $\tr (A+tB)^m$ is positive if $\tr AB >0$ and $m>N(A,B,k)$.

entry.title: Minimal gauging of Dirac, Kahler, and Dirac-Kahler spinors
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: More transition amplitudes on the Riemann sphere
entry.summary: We consider a conformal field theory for bosons on the Riemann sphere. Correlation functions are defined as singular limits of functional integrals. The main result is that these amplitudes define transition amplitudes, that is multilinear Hilbert-Schmidt functionals on a fixed Hilbert space.

entry.title: Evolution equations for eigenvalues and coefficients of polynomials and related generalized dynamics
entry.summary: In this paper we suggest new classification of polynomials and evolution equations for the roots and the coefficients remaing the polynomials within proper class. In the basis of the developed evolution equations we built new dynamics generalizing the relativistic dynamics.
